Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DRW is a diversified trading firm with over 3 decades of experience bringing sophisticated technology and exceptional people together to operate in markets around the world. We value autonomy and the ability to quickly pivot to capture opportunities, so we operate using our own capital and trading at our own risk.

Headquartered in Chicago with offices throughout the U.S., Canada, Europe, and Asia, we trade a variety of asset classes including Fixed Income, ETFs, Equities, FX, Commodities and Energy across all major global markets. We have also leveraged our expertise and technology to expand into three non-traditional strategies: real estate, venture capital and cryptoassets.

We operate with respect, curiosity and open minds. The people who thrive here share our belief that itâ€™s not just what we do that mattersâ€“it's how we do it. DRW is a place of high expectations, integrity, innovation and a willingness to challenge consensus.

As a Data Analyst you will play an integral role in all operational aspects of onboarding, managing and maintaining various datasets used by traders and quantitative researchers. You will work closely with a variety of stakeholders, including technology, front office, operations, research, and risk management. You should be comfortable investigating complex data support issues in a fast-paced environment

What You Will Do In This Role


Help verify, clean, and ensure data is accurate and consistent across systems used for research and analysis by the various trading teams globally
Analyse datasets in order to draw conclusions and provide insight to address stakeholder or project-related questions
Collect metrics and analyse datasets across different dimensions of data quality including; completeness, validity, accuracy, timeliness, and consistency
Perform preliminary root cause analysis of data quality issues
Monitor and work through production data issues whilst engaging key stakeholders across multiple teams and facilitating global support
Assist the wider team by identifying opportunities for improving existing data pipelines


What You Will Need In This Role


Knowledge of a variety of financial instruments, in particular exposure to derivatives instruments
Experience working with SQL
Experience with cloud storage solutions
Prior experience documenting complex processes. Ideally some exposure to Confluence
Python programming skills: PySpark, Pandas, Jupyter Notebooks
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment; strong communication skills are desirable


Additional skills or experience which enhance consideration for this role


Prior experience developing data quality checks using Python
Familiarity with compressed/optimized file formats for data storage such as Parquet and HDF5
Prior experience working with Bloomberg Terminal
Familiarity with Linux and basic Bash scripting skills
Prior experience working with version control software
Experience with workflow management tools (Airflow / Argo)


For more information about DRW's processing activities and our use of job applicants' data, please view our Privacy Notice at https://drw.com/privacy-notice.

California residents, please review the California Privacy Notice for information about certain legal rights at https://drw.com/california-privacy-notice.

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
Company Overview

RFI Global is the only global insights company focusing exclusively on financial services. We empower financial service leaders with the market intelligence they need to drive innovation and accelerate growth.

Partnering with the world's top financial institutions, our expert team delivers tailored insights through a unique hybrid syndicated approach, drawing from over 200,000 consumer and 60,000 business interviews each year.

The Role

The Insights Analyst will be a key member of our dynamic and fast paced research team, creating critical business and market insights that our clients rely on to measure their performance and direct their strategy.

You will gain experience in analysing voice of the customer data, secondary macro data, and corporate case studies. This will provide a base from which you will be trained as an expert in financial services insights, with opportunities to present your findings directly to clients as you grow within the company. This is a fast-paced role where you will be rewarded for your commitment and learning ability.

Importantly, you will see the impact of your work on the largest and most innovative global, regional and national banks.

Start Date: 1 July 2025

Key Responsibilities


Analysis of primary consumer data to provide recommendations and propose actions for client's strategic decision-making
Analysis of secondary data (economic, financial etc) to contextualise RFI's primary research and compile case studies of best practice
Designing questionnaires and supporting with project management during fieldwork
Accurate creation and detailed review of sensitive performance metrics used by our clients within core functions of their institutions, and for market updates
Creating presentation decks which convey complex data in a clear and compelling story for non-technical audiences
Keeping across client briefs and attending client calls, with a view to developing presentation skills
Cross-functional collaboration with team members, including sales, marketing, client services, operations and research teams in our Singapore, London and Sydney offices
Communication of ideas, thinking outside the box and challenging the status quo



Requirements


Essential


Be a self-starter with a positive attitude
Demonstrate curiosity and a problem-solving mindset
Apply critical thinking to every task you take on
Have excellent verbal and written communication skills
Thrive in a fast-paced environment and be comfortable with a steep learning curve
Able to work both autonomously and in a team
Enjoy working in an open and collaborative environment
Be confident multi-tasking and managing multiple deadlines


We welcome applicants from all degree backgrounds.

Desirable

The following skills will be highly regarded but are not essential as full on-the-job training will be provided:


Knowledge of or interest in market research
Knowledge of or interest in the banking and payments industry
Experience with using Q, SPSS, or any other statistical analysis software
Experience using Microsoft Office programs, particularly PowerPoint and Excel



Benefits


Great opportunity to work with a global team
25 days annual leave + public holidays + birthday leave +2 charity days
Hybrid working model with up to 3 remote days per week
Regular employee awards
Monthly breakfast and quarterly social events
Learning and development budget to help your professional growth
Yearly personal wellness fund
Private healthcare
Loyalty leave after 5 years of service
Perkbox
Show more

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Location: West London (Hybrid)

Industry: Retail

Function: CRM Analytics | Loyalty Programmes | Marketing Insight

Contract Type: Permanent




âœ¨ The Opportunity

Are you passionate about turning CRM and loyalty data into actionable insight that improves customer experiences? A major UK organisation, globally recognised in its sector, is looking for a CRM & Loyalty Data Analyst to join its growing marketing data team.

This is a unique opportunity to shape customer strategy in a high-impact environment, using data to optimise marketing communications, loyalty engagement, and customer lifetime value.

Analyse CRM and loyalty programme data to uncover insights that improve targeting, retention, and customer value.
Work with internal and agency teams to report on performance of customer marketing and loyalty campaigns.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As an Data Analyst, you will be part of the Gain Theory Data Practice and will be embedded in one of Gain Theoryâ€™s client based squads. Working with your manager, you will be working on some of the top brands in the world and be hands on with data ranging from media, client specific, Gain Theory specific, sales, and more. You will work as part of a team to process and organize data in preparation for modeling. You will be challenged and have the opportunity to help innovate and automate.

The Data Analyst is expected to make use of data processing techniques including SQL and ETL to handle the data. They will also utilize our internal data automation tools to ensure data pipelines, which clean and transform data, are executed effectively. This person will also run robust data QA processes. The quality of our data is the lifeblood of our work. Additionally, the Data Analyst will work with the Data Manager on co-ordinating with client and agency contacts around continued flow of data from relevant data sources. The role will also interact with the wider data community within Gain Theory, especially with members of the Data Centre or Excellence (DCOE) to share best practice and both provide and receive support.

Our teams bring together cutting-edge data engineering, advanced analytics, unified measurement products and enterprise scalable engineering to build products that will shape the next decade of faster, smarter, data informed decision-making. We believe that consumer privacy, client confidentiality, brand growth and user experience are essential to performance.

Qualifications


Background (1-2 years+) in Computer Science, Data Science, Data Engineering Information Science, Business Intelligence or related quantitative field
In depth experience with all things data including ability to work with a variety of datasets from multiple sources, familiar with standard data processing tools/concepts (e.g. SQL, NoSQL ETL), and experience driving robust QA processes
Experience with the advertising ecosystem (e.g. ad trafficking, Ad servers, DSPs, Media Strategy and Activation, etc.) and a working knowledge of appropriate metrics, measurement, and reporting
Required skillsets: SQL, ETL, Cloud Compute/Storage (Azure or AWS)
Nice to have skillsets: Snowflake, Python, GIT
Experience with DBT is valuable but not required
Has project management skills including planning tasks and deliverables, managing timelines and risks, and overseeing simultaneous projects
Organized, detail-oriented, QA-focused
Excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills
English proficiency

Be Positive: approaching everything we do with a positive mindset and making positive impact on each other.
Act with Consideration: seeing things from someone elseâ€™s perspective; respecting and embracing diverse thinking.
Make it Better: continuous improvement and stretching our abilities, being honest with ourselves and each other.

Gain Theoryâ€¯isâ€¯committed to actively building a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace where everyone feels welcomed, valued and heard, and is treated with dignity and respect. â€¯As leaders and creative partners across industries, it is our responsibility to cultivate an environment reflective of our greatest asset; our people. We believe that this commitment inspires growth and delivers equitable outcomes for everyone as well as the clients and communities we serve.

Meaningful work

Culture with Heart

Title: Qualitative Insights Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Escalent is an award-winning data analytics and advisory firm that helps clients understand human and market behaviors to navigate disruption. As catalysts of progress for more than 40 years, our strategies guide the worldâ€™s leading brands. We accelerate growth by creating a seamless flow between primary, secondary, syndicated, and internal business data, providing consulting and advisory services from insights through implementation. Based on a profound understanding of what drives human beings and markets, we identify actions that build brands, enhance customer experiences, inspire product innovation and boost business productivity. We listen, learn, question, discover, innovate, and deliverâ€”for each other and our clientsâ€”to make the world work better for people.

Why Escalent? Once you join our team you will have the opportunity to...


Access experts across industries for maximum learning opportunities including Weekly Knowledge Sharing Sessions, LinkedIn Learning, and more.
Gain exposure to a rich variety of research techniques from knowledgeable professionals.
Enjoy a remote first/hybrid work environment with a flexible schedule.
Obtain insights into the needs and challenges of your clientsâ€”to learn how the worldâ€™s leading brands use research.
Experience peace of mind working for a company with a commitment to conducting research ethically.
Build lasting relationships with fun colleagues in a culture that values each person.


Role Overview

The Qualitative Insights Analyst will work with a Vice President (lead moderator) and a Project Manager (project management/logistics) to support qualitative projects. They will support all phases of qualitative research projects from design, to execution, to reporting.

This is a role where you could design and deliver research for well-known brands you would recognise. You should have at least 2 - 3 years of work experience to qualify.

Our industry groups have a diverse set of clients offering you the chance to work on projects ranging from large studies that are fielded internationally, to smaller highly custom studies. Across our teams, we have great people, great work, and clients that treat us like an extension of their team. In addition, we have internal experts to help you learn and grow analytically, plus navigate the nuances of our clients' business or industry.

Responsibilities


Design support:
Pre-existing programming experience not required.
Execution support:
Ongoing coordination with moderator, client manager, and research manager to determine where support is needed.
Backroom management during fieldwork (both remote and travel), including client interactions, moderator support, and stimuli.
Monitoring and detailed/strategic notetaking during fieldwork, providing daily summaries to moderator, identifying quotes/video clips for reporting, and contributing to debrief sessions.
Co-moderate methods such as OBBs and TDIs, while advancing moderating skills to be able to tackle more advanced methods/techniques/topics
Continuously monitoring quality level of research conducted and suggest solutions for improving/optimizing research to ensure success.
Insights/Reporting support:
Analyse research results â€“ extract themes, generate insights/summaries, etc.
Extract quotes from qualitative transcripts.
Drafting report sections, most often in PowerPoint, that capture relevant insights with strong visual acuity.
Editing/review of moderator-developed reporting, with the ability to add valuable recommendations on framing insights and/or slide design.
Support video editing/clipping to be used in deliverables.
May assist with coordination of marketing / thought leadership pieces such as blog posts, whitepapers or conference presentations

Basic Qualifications


Must have a Bachelorâ€™s Degree in a field related to the industry group (e.g. business/commerce, economics) and/or a field related to qualitative (e.g. sociology, anthropology, marketing, etc.)
Must have a minimum of 2 years of work experience in a corporate setting, preferably with exposure to finances, market analysis, and/or market research
Excellent written communication skills to be able to summarize findings and implications for clients
Strong verbal communication skills to help lead conversations
Skilled in time management and prioritizing to support multiple clients and projects simultaneously
Proficient in the critical Microsoft software: Office, PowerPoint, Excel, and Word
Comfortable with travel to support research as needed, both within the US


Preferred Qualifications


Interpersonal skills - able to build relationships with colleagues and clients
Understanding of qualitative methods (e.g. focus groups, IDIs, OBBs, etc.)
Understanding of qualitative techniques (e.g. laddering, projectives, etc.)
Understanding of compelling storytelling approaches and visual design techniques for report development is a strong differentiator
Understanding of quantitative methods (e.g. surveys) and analytical techniques (e.g. correlations, kano, etc.)
Experience with video editing


Explore our Careers and Culture page to learn more about the people behind the brand: https://escalent.co/careers-and-culture/

Equal Opportunity Employer: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, or other legally protected status.

Title: ESG Data Analyst/ Associate
Description:
ESG Data Analyst / Associate, Asset Management, London, Hybrid

Department: Responsible Investment




Our client is a leading provider investments and wealth management. The Responsible Investment team is seeking a highly motivated ESG Data Analyst/ Associate. This role involves collecting, analysing, and reporting on ESG data, which will support the organisation's sustainability initiatives. You will play a crucial role in delivering essential ESG data to investors and other stakeholders. Additionally, this role includes contributing to ongoing ESG integration activities, such as manager and fund research oversight.




We are seeking candidates passionate about sustainability and responsible investment, eager to use data and technology to enhance investment decisions and outcomes for customers.




Key Responsibilities

Support day-to-day ESG data operations, including report creation, data validation, responding to investor queries, and investigating data anomalies.
Develop tools and resources to support ESG analysis and oversight across portfolios, funds, and securities.
Drive the automation and systemisation of processes across reporting, data delivery, stewardship, and portfolio oversight.
Strengthen ESG data strategy by designing and implementing robust validation and monitoring frameworks.
Analyse ESG data to identify trends, risks, and opportunities, and assess new data sources for investment relevance.
Produce clear reports, dashboards, and presentations to communicate ESG insights to internal and external stakeholders.
Provide data-backed recommendations to inform ESG strategy and implementation.
Collaborate with internal teams such as Data Management, Investment Risk, and others to expand responsible investment (RI) data and reporting capabilities.




Weâ€™re looking for someone who brings:

Technical fluency in tools such as Python, R, PL/SQL, DAX, Power BI, Power Query, and Power Automate.
Strong analytical skills, with experience in statistical analysis, data visualisation, and data mining.
A proven ability to present complex insights clearly â€“ including writing reports and delivering analytical papers.
Solid research and investigative capabilities across varied data sources.
A good understanding of ESG frameworks and reporting standards.
Familiarity with investment concepts and how ESG factors impact financial and investment decision-making.
Experience across the coding project lifecycle.
Exposure to platforms such as FactSet, RIMES, Bloomberg, Morningstar Direct, Thinkfolio, and Dasseti.
A sound understanding of securities, funds, and portfolio construction â€“ with hands-on experience running fund and portfolio analytics.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Introduction

Join us at Gallagher Re, the trailblazers of the reinsurance world, where every day brings new opportunities to shape the future. We empower our clients with cutting-edge analytics and insights, providing them the confidence to make strategic decisions that transform industries. As a team member, you'll be at the forefront of innovation, translating data into impactful solutions and taking the reins of your career like never before.

We believe that every candidate brings something special to the table, including you! So, even if you feel that youâ€™re close but not an exact match, we encourage you to apply.

Overview

Gallagher Re are looking to hire an experienced insurance Senior Data Analyst to join our growing analytics team.

This opportunity will play a critical role in delivering sophisticated data analysis to support the placement of insurance and reinsurance programs for our clients across various lines of business and territories.

Gallagher Re's Data and Analytics team is instrumental in driving innovation and delivering strategic value through data. Their expertise in analytics and commitment to excellence positions Gallagher Re as a leader in the reinsurance industry.

This role will be based from our London office with an expectation of being on site two days per week.

How You'll Make An Impact


Collaborate with brokers and clients to understand data requirements and provide advanced data-driven insights to support insurance and reinsurance placements.
Utilise advanced data analysis techniques and visualisation tools to analyse large and complex datasets, providing insights on market trends, claims experience, loss ratios, and other key performance indicators.
Develop and optimise data pipelines using Microsoft Azure Data Factory and other Azure tools to ensure efficient data processing and analysis.
Design and implement analytical tools and dashboards to support strategic data-driven decision-making across the organisation.
Lead the development and implementation of robust data quality checks and controls to ensure data accuracy and completeness.
Stay at the forefront of industry trends and emerging technologies in data analysis, visualisation, and data pipelining.
Contribute to the development of bespoke client data models


About You


Proven experience gained in a Senior Data Analyst/Engineering role, with a focus on technical data pipelining and analysis in the insurance or reinsurance industry.
Advanced proficiency in data analysis and visualisation tools such as SQL, Python, Power BI, and Microsoft Excel.
Extensive experience with Microsoft Azure toolkit, including data storage and analytics services such as Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Factory, and Azure Analysis Services.
Excellent problem-solving skills and meticulous attention to detail.
Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
A degree in a related field such as statistics, mathematics, computer science, or engineering would be an advantage but is not essential.


Compensation And Benefits

On top of a competitive salary, great teams and exciting career opportunities, we also offer a wide range of benefits.

Below are the minimum core benefits youâ€™ll get, depending on your job level these benefits may improve:


Minimum of 25 days holiday, plus bank holidays, and the option to â€˜buyâ€™ extra days
Defined contribution pension scheme, which Gallagher will also contribute to
Life insurance, which will pay 4x your basic annual salary, which you can top-up to 10x
Income protection, weâ€™ll cover up to 50% of your annual income, with options to top up
Health cash plan or Private medical insurance


Other benefits include:


Three fully paid volunteering days per year
Employee Stock Purchase plan, offering company shares at a discount
Share incentive plan, HMRC approved, tax effective, stock purchase plan
Critical illness cover
Discounted gym membership, with over 3,000 gyms nationally
Season ticket loan
Access to a discounted voucher portal to save money on your weekly shop or next big purchase
Emergency back-up family care
And many moreâ€¦


We value inclusion and diversity

Inclusion and diversity (I&D) is a core part of our business, and itâ€™s embedded into the fabric of our organisation. For more than 95 years, Gallagher has led with a commitment to sustainability and to support the communities where we live and work.

Gallagher embraces our employeesâ€™ diverse identities, experiences and talents, allowing us to better serve our clients and communities. We see inclusion as a conscious commitment and diversity as a vital strength. By embracing diversity in all its forms, we live out The Gallagher Way to its fullest.

Gallagher is Disability Confident Committed. We have pledged to make sure our recruitment process is inclusive and accessible, in addition to supporting our existing employees with any long-term health conditions or disabilities.

We understand that applicants may have disabilities, if you do, you may find some parts of the recruitment process more challenging than others. Donâ€™t worry, weâ€™re here to help, however, we can only do this if you let us know.

Should you require reasonable adjustments to your application, please get in touch with TAGlobalSupport@ajg.com . If youâ€™d prefer to speak on the phone, please request a call back, leaving details, so we get in touch.

Our employing entity, Arthur J. Gallagher Services (UK) Limited, is proud to be accredited as a Living Wage employer with the Living Wage Foundation. We are committed to diversity and opportunity for all and are opposed to any form of less favourable treatment on the grounds of gender or gender identity, marital status, civil partnership status, parental status, race, ethnicity, colour, nationality, disability, sexual orientation, religion/ belief, age and those with caring responsibilities.

Gallagher believes that all persons are entitled to equal employment opportunity and prohibits any form of discrimination by its managers, employees, vendors or customers based on race, color, religion, creed, gender (including pregnancy status), sexual orientation, gender identity (which includes transgender and other gender non-conforming individuals), gender expression, hair expression, marital status, parental status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, medical condition, genetic information, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other characteristic protected (herein referred to as â€œprotected characteristicsâ€) by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

Equal employment opportunity will be extended in all aspects of the employer-employee relationship, including, but not limited to, recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, transfer, demotion, compensation, benefits, layoff, and termination. In addition, Gallagher will make reasonable accommodations to known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified person with a disability, unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business.

On top of a competitive salary, great teams and exciting career opportunities, we also offer a wide range of benefits.

Below are the minimum core benefits youâ€™ll get, depending on your job level these benefits may improve:

  • Minimum of 25 days holiday, plus bank holidays, and the option to â€˜buyâ€™ extra days
  • Defined contribution pension scheme, which Gallagher will also contribute to
  • Life insurance, which will pay 4x your basic annual salary, which you can top-up to 10x
  • Income protection, weâ€™ll cover up to 50% of your annual income, with options to top up
  • Health cash plan or Private medical insurance

Other benefits include:

  • Three fully paid volunteering days per year
  • Employee Stock Purchase plan, offering company shares at a discount
  • Share incentive plan, HMRC approved, tax effective, stock purchase plan
  • Critical illness cover
  • Discounted gym membership, with over 3,000 gyms nationally
  • Season ticket loan
  • Access to a discounted voucher portal to save money on your weekly shop or next big purchase
  • Emergency back-up family care
  • And many moreâ€¦

We value inclusion and diversity

Inclusion and diversity (I&D) is a core part of our business, and itâ€™s embedded into the fabric of our organisation. For more than 95 years, Gallagher has led with a commitment to sustainability and to support the communities where we live and work.

Gallagher embraces our employeesâ€™ diverse identities, experiences and talents, allowing us to better serve our clients and communities. We see inclusion as a conscious commitment and diversity as a vital strength. By embracing diversity in all its forms, we live out The Gallagher Way to its fullest.

Gallagher is Disability Confident Committed. We have pledged to make sure our recruitment process is inclusive and accessible, in addition to supporting our existing employees with any long-term health conditions or disabilities.

We understand that applicants may have disabilities, if you do, you may find some parts of the recruitment process more challenging than others. Donâ€™t worry, weâ€™re here to help, however, we can only do this if you let us know.

Should you require reasonable adjustments to your application, please get in touch with TAGlobalSupport@ajg.com . If youâ€™d prefer to speak on the phone, please request a call back, leaving details, so we get in touch.

Our employing entity, Arthur J. Gallagher Services (UK) Limited, is proud to be accredited as a Living Wage employer with the Living Wage Foundation. We are committed to diversity and opportunity for all and are opposed to any form of less favourable treatment on the grounds of gender or gender identity, marital status, civil partnership status, parental status, race, ethnicity, colour, nationality, disability, sexual orientation, religion/ belief, age and those with caring responsibilities.

Gallagher believes that all persons are entitled to equal employment opportunity and prohibits any form of discrimination by its managers, employees, vendors or customers based on race, color, religion, creed, gender (including pregnancy status), sexual orientation, gender identity (which includes transgender and other gender non-conforming individuals), gender expression, hair expression, marital status, parental status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, medical condition, genetic information, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other characteristic protected (herein referred to as â€œprotected characteristicsâ€) by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

Equal employment opportunity will be extended in all aspects of the employer-employee relationship, including, but not limited to, recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, transfer, demotion, compensation, benefits, layoff, and termination. In addition, Gallagher will make reasonable accommodations to known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified person with a disability, unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business.

Title: Digital Analyst
Description:
Weâ€™re looking for a Digital Analyst to join our Digital Analytics team at Harrods. In this role, youâ€™ll interpret, report on, and analyse digital performance data, while playing a key role in our testing and optimisation initiatives.

About The Role

As a Digital Analyst, you'll work closely with the Senior Digital Analyst to explore performance data, support tracking enhancements, lead insight projects, and contribute to A/B testingâ€”all with the goal of delivering strategic value and immediate commercial impact. You'll serve as a key contact for insights into online performance, marketing trends, and the competitor landscape.

Your responsibilities will include:


Collaborating with internal and external Analytics and Research teams to deliver actionable insights that drive decision-making
Staying informed on digital trends and changes in areas such as cookie tracking and online measurement
Working with stakeholders to develop test hypotheses, define requirements, review designs, and create development tickets
Effectively communicating digital analytics findings across the business, including presentations to senior leadership


About You

Youâ€™re experienced with digital measurement tools like Google Analytics and Contentsquare, and confident in challenging assumptions to get to the core of business needs. Strong storytelling and presentation skills are essential.

Youâ€™ll also bring:


Experience with Google Tag Manager, GA4, SQL, and A/B testing
A naturally curious mindset, with a passion for solving problems and finding the right analytical approach to deliver insights
The ability to turn data into clear, compelling stories that drive action


Join us and be part of shaping the future of digital at Harrods.

About Us

Harrods is one of the worldâ€™s leading luxury department stores and weâ€™re becoming a destination for top designers, and the most sought-after brands from around the globe. Our combined mission is to make visiting our iconic Knightsbridge store one of the worldâ€™s most inspiring shopping experiences.

Our Promise to You

Help us make the impossible possible for our customers and weâ€™ll do something remarkable for you. As well as offering a friendly environment to inspire your best work, we provide abundant opportunities and support to build an exceptional career across the varied specialisms of our business.

Uniquely You

Whilst our job adverts outline the ideal qualities, skills, and prior experience for the role, we believe in the potential for growth and value individual strengths. If you can demonstrate the majority of skills and strong experience to thrive in this role, we would encourage you to apply.

At Harrods we believe the personality and authenticity of our people sets us apart. We celebrate and invite applications from all cultures, backgrounds, tastes, and experiences and are proud of our culture where people from all walks of life can grow and thrive. What makes you unique makes us exceptional.

If you want to know more about life at Harrods, search #TogetherHarrods on LinkedIn, or follow us on Instagram @togetherharrods.

Title: Junior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Junior Data Analyst â€“ Google Sheets

Location: London

Duration: 3 months

About the Role:

We are looking for a motivated Junior Data Analyst to support our risk management team by extracting and compiling data for monthly risk reports. This is an excellent opportunity for someone early in their data career who wants to develop their skills in SQL, Google Sheets, and working with large datasets like those in BigQuery, while gaining exposure to risk management practices.

Key Responsibilities:


Assist in extracting data from the central Risk system using SQL queries.
Compile and organize data manually into monthly risk management reports using Google Sheets.
Work closely with senior team members to ensure data accuracy and consistency
Learn to handle large datasets using BigQuery under guidance.
Maintain strong attention to detail in all data-related tasks.
Support ongoing efforts to improve reporting processes within the team.


Must-Have Qualifications:


Basic experience with SQL and comfort writing simple queries
Proficiency in Google Sheets including functions and data organization.
Willingness to learn and develop skills in BigQuery or similar data platforms.
Strong attention to detail and a methodical approach to work.
Good communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively in a team.
Some familiarity or interest in risk management or financial services.
Exposure to or interest in data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio, Tableau, or Power BI.
Experience or coursework involving data analysis or reporting.

Title: Analyst
Description:
Gas Strategies is looking for an ambitious and capable person with an advanced quantitative and analytical ability to join the Consulting Team.




Accurate and precise, with an advanced level of Excel proficiency, the successful candidate will have some experience within the energy industry and will have developed a good understanding of current market dynamics. The role provides the first step on a career path towards a Consultant role in our well-established and successful global professional services consulting firm.




Purpose of Role

Responsible for the delivery of accurate, relevant, and efficient client-focused data analysis, market research, and modelling that exhibits a clarity of understanding of clientsâ€™ concerns and supports clientsâ€™ commercial decision making. This includes the ability to clearly articulate results and findings, in written and oral presentations, to both colleagues and clients.




Key Performance Indicators & Role Description




Data Modelling

To lead on the building and customisation of economic/commercial models for financial simulation and scenario planning as it pertains to key projects
To support the development and configuration of various in-house tools and models to deliver high value functionality
Develop and improve forecasting/modelling approaches and techniques




Data Management

Use a variety of tasks and methods to organise/analyse data from multiple sources with high degrees of rigour
Use systems and programming knowledge, personal experience, clientsâ€™ needs and project goals to provide business decision-making support
Assist with the development and utilisation of Gas Strategies Online products




Data Analysis

Break down issues and tasks into manageable parts in a systematic way and identify relationships between parts
Make the results of analysis understandable, enabling others to buy-in or accept conclusions
Identify, explore, and discuss client needs in order to identify all relevant parameters for inclusion in data models
Discuss and agree the approach to and allocation of project tasks with peers and project managers
Identify data risk elements and assumptions to determine implications and consequences of analysis
Provide technical data modelling assistance to other team members
Understand and interpret underlying research requirements and assumptions in order to identify suitable sources of relevant data
Assist with project delivery through the provision of inputs into presentations and projects
Co-ordinate timely execution and delivery of project outputs as agreed by project timelines




Consulting

Liaise, communicate and network with clients/project leaders to deliver client assignments
Develop good quality project content and reports and oversee quality/evaluation of technical material
Presentation of results and findings to clients




Essential requirements and experience:

Excellent numerate ability with high-level Excel and economic modelling ability
Have a significant background in economic forecasting methods and techniques
Experience of analysing complex data and deriving real business decision support (with tangible benefits to the business)
Have an interest and affinity for the energy and gas industry that is consistent with Gas Strategies Groupâ€™s positioning as a key provider of professional services at the heart of the industry
A team player who relishes the challenge of new experiences and exhibits a willingness to seek out opportunities within the business
Ability to quickly learn new concepts and apply these to the wider business context




Desirable requirements:

Have at least 1-2 yearsâ€™ experience of the energy industry, preferably within the global gas sector
Some exposure to consulting and client interaction would be advantageous




Personal Attributes:

Demonstrate accuracy and meticulous attention to detail
Strong planning, organisational, and time management skills
Creative problem-solving ability

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Our Emerging Talent Programme at Enstar is designed to build a great foundation in data analytics and machine learning within the insurance industry. It combines technical training, real-world business exposure, and structured development to support a successful transition from education to career. Over two years, participants will take part in tailored learning opportunities, rotational placements, and mentoring to develop critical thinking, data proficiency, and cross-functional awareness.




About the Role




This position sits within the Data Office. The team supports data-driven decision making across the organisation and contributes to developing ethical, responsible artificial intelligence capabilities




Responsibilities




Conducting statistical analysis and applying machine learning techniques to insurance and financial data
Supporting data preparation and transformation for analytical purposes
Developing, testing, and refining predictive models
Presenting insights to stakeholders and translating analytical outputs into business context
Collaborating with engineers and analysts across departments
Contributing to projects related to responsible AI, governance, and compliance







Qualifications




Candidates should have or be expecting to achieve a degree in a subject area such as Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or another quantitative field.




Required Skills




Familiarity with supervised and unsupervised learning (e.g. regression, classification, clustering)
Basic experience in Python, R, or SQL, and familiarity with libraries such as Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch
Experience with data visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Awareness of data privacy, responsible AI, and ethical technology practices
Ability to convey technical ideas clearly and work collaboratively







Preferred Skills




Our graduates follow a structured development framework that includes:

Formal training aligned to a professional qualification
Technical and behavioural skills workshops
Real business assignments and rotations
Regular feedback and access to mentoring from experienced professionals




Pay range and compensation package




We offer a comprehensive package to support wellbeing, financial planning, and professional development. Benefits include:




10% employer pension contribution
Â£700 annual wellness reimbursement
Private medical and dental insurance
Health screening and wellbeing support
Cycle to Work scheme and electric vehicle lease
â€Employee Assistance Programme
Volunteering days and inclusive events




ðŸŒ Equal Opportunity Statement




Enstar is committed to creating an inclusive, respectful, and accessible workplace. We support candidates from all backgrounds and provide support and adjustments throughout the recruitment process. Applicants who require accommodations are encouraged to let us know at any stage. Enstar is an equal opportunity employer. We believe diversity of thought and experience strengthens decision-making and performance.




Recruitment Process




ðŸ“ Online application
ðŸŽ¥ Online assessment and recorded interview
ðŸ’» Virtual assessment centre

  • Basic experience in Python, R, or SQL, and familiarity with libraries such as Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch
  • Experience with data visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau
  • Awareness of data privacy, responsible AI, and ethical technology practices
  • Ability to convey technical ideas clearly and work collaboratively



Preferred Skills


Our graduates follow a structured development framework that includes:

  • Formal training aligned to a professional qualification
  • Technical and behavioural skills workshops
  • Real business assignments and rotations
  • Regular feedback and access to mentoring from experienced professionals


Pay range and compensation package


We offer a comprehensive package to support wellbeing, financial planning, and professional development. Benefits include:


  • 10% employer pension contribution
  • Â£700 annual wellness reimbursement
  • Private medical and dental insurance
  • Health screening and wellbeing support
  • Cycle to Work scheme and electric vehicle lease
  • â€Employee Assistance Programme
  • Volunteering days and inclusive events

Applicants who require accommodations are encouraged to let us know at any stage. Enstar is an equal opportunity employer. We believe diversity of thought and experience strengthens decision-making and performance.

Title: Junior Analyst
Description:
We are looking for an innovative, analytical thinker to join our Gas Operations team. Are you looking to build the foundations of a strong, fast-paced career in the energy industry with a growing independent energy supplier?




What Will I Do?

As a Junior Operations Analyst you will be responsible for the analysis and interpretation of data from a variety of sources, identifying anomalies as appropriate. Working alongside internal stakeholders, and a number of third-parties you will support the resolution of customersâ€™ queries, always ensuring customer data is up-to-date and accurately reflects our billing systems.




What Skills Do I Need?

This role would be ideally suited to someone who is highly numerate with a great eye for detail and is comfortable working with large datasets. Ideally you will already have a working knowledge of Microsoft Excel and be able to learn our internal database systems and processes.




What can we offer?

This role offers a competitive package of remuneration along with access to a wide range of company benefits which includes;

Private medical insurance, including 24/7 GP appointments and access to a wide range of professional support. We also offer a life assurance and income protection scheme from day one!
Our annual company profit share scheme, rewarding everyone at Corona by sharing in our success.
Employee self-sacrifice Electric Vehicle scheme, with a wide range of different models to choose from â€“ supporting our commitment to the energy transition.
Access to thousands of retail and entertainment discounts through our internal rewards and recognition scheme, all linked to our company values.




On top of these great benefits, we also continue to invest in our people through a wealth of development opportunities, supporting you to get the most from your career!




Working Pattern

In this role you will be able to work on a hybrid pattern, with Tues-Thurs in the office and Monday and Friday at home. Our standard office hours are 0830 â€“ 1700, Monday to Friday.




Working with us at Corona Energy

At Corona Energy we are driven by our company culture which is focused around our core values; Empowered, Forward Thinking and Impactful â€“ these are underpinned by our central value â€œCustomer Firstâ€. This year we were proud to have been independently certified as one of the Best Places to Work in the UK with over 80% of our team recognising our outstanding employee experience!




To support this experience, we also offer our team;

Amazing office spaces, with complimentary breakfast, fruit, snacks and drinks throughout the day.
An annual focus on wellbeing with events and activities to support your health, wealth and inner-self!
An opportunity to support our charity partners, or to give back to important causes by fundraising or volunteering our time.
The chance to celebrate success together, at one of our regular sports and social events or at our annual company awards.




If you are looking for a career that is all about positive energy, we would welcome your application!




Corona Energy is a Disability Confident employer and as such will offer any successful applicant whatever reasonable adjustments they may require in order to take part in our recruitment process.

Title: Data Design Analyst
Description:
At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.

Become part of a team working on some of the most rewarding, large-scale creative projects to be found in any entertainment medium - all within an inclusive, highly-motivated environment where you can learn and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.

Rockstar Games is on the lookout for a passionate Data Design Analyst with strong software development skills who possesses a passion for both games and big data.

This is a full-time, permanent and in-office position based in Rockstarâ€™s unique game development studio in the heart of London.

What We Do


The Rockstar Analytics team provides insights and actionable results to a wide variety of stakeholders across the organization in support of their decision making.
We partner with multiple departments across the company, leveraging analytics to measure and improve the success and health of our games.
We collaborate as a global team to develop cutting-edge data pipelines, data products, data models, reports, analyses, and machine learning applications.
The Business Analytics vertical within the Analytics team is tasked with empowering Rockstar with data by helping design and implement game telemetry that drives better gameplay, player engagement, and business decisions.
We aim to win hearts and minds by making data accessible, insightful, and actionable â€“ building strong relationships with developers, designers, and stakeholders to ensure data is embraced as a core part of game development.


Responsibilities


Partner with game designers, developers, and other stakeholders to help design and implement robust telemetry that supports long-term insights.
Bridge the gap between data and non-data teams, ensuring our data meets the needs for achieving great game balance, player experience, and business intelligence.
Advocate for the power of data, helping teams understand its value and how it can shape better decision-making.
Build strong relationships across teams and time zones, influencing and educating stakeholders to drive data-informed decisions.
Create impactful visualizations and reports using SQL, Excel, and Tableau (preferred) to make complex insights accessible.
Support our internal data team by refining telemetry taxonomy and contributing to ongoing data developments.


Qualifications


Bachelorâ€™s degree in a relevant field (e.g. Data Analytics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Business, or related).
3 â€“ 5 years of experience in game analytics, data analytics, or business intelligence.
Hands-on experience with SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools (Tableau preferred).
Familiarity with data telemetry, taxonomy, and cloud analytics (Databricks, etc).


Skills


Telemetry or other data design experience
Analytical mindset â€“ ability to turn data into actionable insights.
Strong communication and storytelling â€“ able to make complex data accessible and engaging.
Collaboration & relationship-building â€“ skilled at working across teams and time zones.
Problem-solving & initiative â€“ proactive in improving data systems and processes.
Stakeholder influence â€“ able to advocate for data-driven decision-making.


PLUSES

Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.


Experience with Python & Pyspark.
Experience with GitHub.
Experience in the game industry or with game telemetry design.
Passion for gaming in general.


How To Apply

Please apply with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the skills above. If we would like to move forward with your application, a Rockstar recruiter will reach out to you to explain next steps and guide you through the process.

Rockstar is committed to creating a work environment that promotes equal opportunity, dignity and respect. In line with this commitment, Rockstar will provide reasonable accommodations to qualified job applicants with disabilities during the recruitment process in order for such applicants to be considered for the position for which they are applying, as well as to qualified employees to enable them to perform the essential functions of their roles. If you need more information about Rockstarâ€™s reasonable accommodation policies or process, or need to request an accommodation, please contact the Human Resources Department.

If youâ€™ve got the right skills for the job, we want to hear from you. We encourage applications from all suitable candidates regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, race, or any other protected category.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Role

The Data Analyst will be responsible for collecting, analysing, and visualising key operational data across the University to drive informed decision-making. This role will focus on identifying trends and patterns in data related to estates and facilities, HR/People analytics, finance, and operational efficiency. Working with stakeholders across multiple departments, the post holder will generate reports and dashboards to enhance service levels, resource allocation, and performance monitoring.

This position is ideal for a data-driven professional with 2â€“3 years of experience in data analytics, reporting, and business intelligence tools, who can apply analytical insights to support University-wide operations effectively.

Key Responsibilities

Data Processing, Analysis & Reporting


Collect, clean, and analyse datasets from multiple sources, including workforce management, scheduling, finance, and HR systems.
Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI
Identify trends and insights to support strategic decision-making.


Business Intelligence & Performance Analytics


Extract and analyse data from various systems such as Timegate, Servicetrac, and Liberty Telephone.
Provide performance insights and recommendations based on data analysis.


Stakeholder Engagement & Communication


Collaborate with different departments across the University to understand data needs and deliver actionable insights.
Communicate data-driven findings to senior leadership and operations teams.
Assist in preparing presentations and reports for internal stakeholders.


Financial & HR Data Analysis


Assist with financial reporting, ensuring a sound understanding of key financial metrics.
Analyse HR/People data to support workforce planning and compliance monitoring.
Support data-driven decision-making in resource allocation and performance management.


Process Improvement & Innovation


Continuously explore new tools and methodologies to enhance data analysis and reporting efficiency.
Assist in automating and streamlining data processes to improve accuracy and reduce manual workload.


The above list of responsibilities may not be exhaustive, and the post holder will be required to undertake other duties as reasonably expected within the scope and grading of the role.

Knowledge of Microsoft Power Automate or Power Apps would be beneficial but is not essential.

You May be asked to complete a test during the interview

This is a full time post (35 Hours per week), and you will be offered an indefinite contract

About You

To be successful in this role, we are looking for candidates to have the following skills and experience:

Essential Criteria


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret data and generate insights
Experience working with operational, HR, or financial data
Ability to work efficiently under pressure and meet deadlines with Strong teamwork and collaboration skills.
Ability to work independently and proactively
Prior experience in an Admin role
Advanced user of Power BI (Portfolio to be attached in the cv and cover letter)
Presentation skills: ability to produce and deliver data-driven presentations
Sound understanding of financial metrics and analysis


Desirable criteria


Experience with Power Automate or Power App
Understanding of Soft Facilities Management


Downloading a Copy Of Our Job Description

Full details of the role and the skills, knowledge and experience required can be found in the Job Description document, provided at the bottom of the next page after you click â€œApply Nowâ€. This document will provide information of what criteria will be assessed at each stage of the recruitment process.

We pride ourselves on being inclusive and welcoming. We embrace diversity and want everyone to feel that they belong and are connected to others in our community.

We are committed to working with our staff and unions on these and other issues, to continue to support our people and to develop a diverse and inclusive culture at King's.

As part of this commitment to equality, diversity and inclusion and through this appointment process, it is our aim to develop candidate pools that include applicants from all backgrounds and communities.

We ask all candidates to submit a copy of their CV, and a supporting statement, detailing how they meet the essential criteria listed in the advert. If we receive a strong field of candidates, we may use the desirable criteria to choose our final shortlist, so please include your evidence against these where possible.

Grade and Salary: Â£38,482 - Â£43,249 per annum inclusive of London Weighting

Close Date: 01-Jun-2025

Contact Person: Leandro Zaccari

Contact Details: Css-recruitment@kcl.ac.uk

Title: Qualitative Insights Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Escalent is an award-winning data analytics and advisory firm that helps clients understand human and market behaviors to navigate disruption. As catalysts of progress for more than 40 years, our strategies guide the worldâ€™s leading brands. We accelerate growth by creating a seamless flow between primary, secondary, syndicated, and internal business data, providing consulting and advisory services from insights through implementation. Based on a profound understanding of what drives human beings and markets, we identify actions that build brands, enhance customer experiences, inspire product innovation and boost business productivity. We listen, learn, question, discover, innovate, and deliverâ€”for each other and our clientsâ€”to make the world work better for people.

Why Escalent? Once you join our team you will have the opportunity to...


Access experts across industries for maximum learning opportunities including Weekly Knowledge Sharing Sessions, LinkedIn Learning, and more.
Gain exposure to a rich variety of research techniques from knowledgeable professionals.
Enjoy a remote first/hybrid work environment with a flexible schedule.
Obtain insights into the needs and challenges of your clientsâ€”to learn how the worldâ€™s leading brands use research.
Experience peace of mind working for a company with a commitment to conducting research ethically.
Build lasting relationships with fun colleagues in a culture that values each person.


Role Overview

The Qualitative Insights Analyst will work with a Vice President (lead moderator) and a Project Manager (project management/logistics) to support qualitative projects. They will support all phases of qualitative research projects from design, to execution, to reporting.

This is a role where you could design and deliver research for well-known brands you would recognise. You should have at least 2 - 3 years of work experience to qualify.

Our industry groups have a diverse set of clients offering you the chance to work on projects ranging from large studies that are fielded internationally, to smaller highly custom studies. Across our teams, we have great people, great work, and clients that treat us like an extension of their team. In addition, we have internal experts to help you learn and grow analytically, plus navigate the nuances of our clients' business or industry.

Responsibilities


Design support:
Pre-existing programming experience not required.
Execution support:
Ongoing coordination with moderator, client manager, and research manager to determine where support is needed.
Backroom management during fieldwork (both remote and travel), including client interactions, moderator support, and stimuli.
Monitoring and detailed/strategic notetaking during fieldwork, providing daily summaries to moderator, identifying quotes/video clips for reporting, and contributing to debrief sessions.
Co-moderate methods such as OBBs and TDIs, while advancing moderating skills to be able to tackle more advanced methods/techniques/topics
Continuously monitoring quality level of research conducted and suggest solutions for improving/optimizing research to ensure success.
Insights/Reporting support:
Analyse research results â€“ extract themes, generate insights/summaries, etc.
Extract quotes from qualitative transcripts.
Drafting report sections, most often in PowerPoint, that capture relevant insights with strong visual acuity.
Editing/review of moderator-developed reporting, with the ability to add valuable recommendations on framing insights and/or slide design.
Support video editing/clipping to be used in deliverables.
May assist with coordination of marketing / thought leadership pieces such as blog posts, whitepapers or conference presentations

Basic Qualifications


Must have a Bachelorâ€™s Degree in a field related to the industry group (e.g. business/commerce, economics) and/or a field related to qualitative (e.g. sociology, anthropology, marketing, etc.)
Must have a minimum of 2 years of work experience in a corporate setting, preferably with exposure to finances, market analysis, and/or market research
Excellent written communication skills to be able to summarize findings and implications for clients
Strong verbal communication skills to help lead conversations
Skilled in time management and prioritizing to support multiple clients and projects simultaneously
Proficient in the critical Microsoft software: Office, PowerPoint, Excel, and Word
Comfortable with travel to support research as needed, both within the US


Preferred Qualifications


Interpersonal skills - able to build relationships with colleagues and clients
Understanding of qualitative methods (e.g. focus groups, IDIs, OBBs, etc.)
Understanding of qualitative techniques (e.g. laddering, projectives, etc.)
Understanding of compelling storytelling approaches and visual design techniques for report development is a strong differentiator
Understanding of quantitative methods (e.g. surveys) and analytical techniques (e.g. correlations, kano, etc.)
Experience with video editing


Explore our Careers and Culture page to learn more about the people behind the brand: https://escalent.co/careers-and-culture/

Equal Opportunity Employer: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, or other legally protected status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Reward & People Data Analyst

Location: Central London (close to Tottenham Court Road)

Salary: Up to Â£60,000 + Generous Bonus

Industry: Global Investment & Advisory Group




Are you a data-driven professional with a passion for reward, analytics, and compensation strategy? A leading global investment and advisory group is looking for a Reward & People Data Analyst to join their dynamic HR team in the heart of London.




About the Role

In this pivotal role, youâ€™ll be instrumental in shaping and enhancing the firmâ€™s reward structures and supporting the annual compensation cycle. You will work closely with senior HR stakeholders, providing data-led insights and technical support to inform decision-making and ensure the business continues to attract, retain, and reward top talent.




Key Responsibilities

Support the design and delivery of annual compensation reviews, including collation and analysis of internal and external compensation data
Provide analytical support for reward-related projects, policies, and processes
Partner with payroll and HR operations teams to ensure accurate and timely employee compensation in line with local practices
Maintain and develop dashboards and reports to support reward and workforce analytics using Excel and Power BI
Interpret complex data sets to provide clear, actionable insights for HR and business leaders
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across all people-related systems and reporting processes




What Weâ€™re Looking For

Strong background in HR data analytics or reward/compensation roles
Exceptional Excel skills; experience using Power BI is highly desirable
Comfortable working with large, complex data sets
Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving capabilities
A collaborative mindset and the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Experience working within financial or professional services environments is a plus




Whatâ€™s on Offer

Salary up to Â£60,000 (DOE)
Generous performance-related bonus
Opportunity to work within a respected, global organisation
Collaborative and high-performing team culture
Hybrid working environment




Interested?

If you're looking to take the next step in your reward analytics career and join a business where your insights will shape strategic outcomes, weâ€™d love to hear from you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Iglu Why You'll Love Working Here

At Iglu.com, we're more than just a travel company â€” weâ€™re the UKâ€™s leading online cruise retailer, and weâ€™re redefining what it means to book a cruise in the digital age.

Working At Iglu Means


ðŸ’¬ Flat structure, real impact â€“ Your ideas matter. Everyone contributes, and youâ€™ll see the results of your work fast.
ðŸŒ´ Cruise perks & travel love â€“ Weâ€™re in the business of adventure, and youâ€™ll feel it.
ðŸ§  Smart, supportive people â€“ Join a talented, close-knit team that genuinely enjoys solving hard problems together.
ðŸš€ Room to grow â€“ Weâ€™re on a transformation journey, and thereâ€™s huge opportunity to shape the future with us.
Training and development - Paid for training, conferences and certification e.g. AWS Certs.


We combine a passion for travel with a love for technology, delivering smart, seamless customer experiences and building platforms that handle the complexity of modern cruising â€” all while keeping things collaborative and fun.

About The Role

You will be working within our Analytics team, cross functionally serving different areas of our growing travel business.

Data At Iglu

This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing and crucial function of the business, your day to day responsibilities will be to generate insight, ensure effective communication and adoption into the business processes.

Analysing data, identifying trends, forecasting and modelling to make recommendations to the business. This is a varied role, looking at all aspects of the business, and will require a good work ethic and an ability to work quickly and diligently. This is an opportunity to have a positive impact on the business by driving change and continuous improvement, and evaluating the impact of these changes.

Responsibilities


Interrogate and analyse data to establish market and product trends, find new opportunities, improve efficiency and build forecasts models, across the cruise sectors
Present findings & recommendations to the management team to support the running of the business, drive growth and efficiencies;
Work alongside the BI Team, to validate data and facilitate new data points and sources;
Work closely with other departments to ensure their reporting needs are being met, help identify new areas for analysis as required;
Create daily, weekly and ad-hoc reporting on performance, trends and opportunities;
Produce written documentation to support your work, report on your findings an to present to stakeholders when necessary;
Provide continued reporting and evaluation on the impact of changes made;


Key Skills


Proven project experience with SQL, experience with Python packages a plus
Proficiency with data visualisation software (Tableau preferred)
Business acumen, a passion in learning how businesses operate, which strategies are implemented and which industry trends buffet and boost the business.
Microsoft office/G Suite proficiency, especially with Excel


About You


Have an appetite for personal development
Display great self awareness around time management and prioritisation
Are diligent and conscientious
Show adaptability and resilience
Have personal drive
Are focused
Are trusted by others and offer support
Communicate well with others within their own department and across the business
Show accountability and embrace responsibility
Have previous g-suite experience

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DRW is a diversified trading firm with over 3 decades of experience bringing sophisticated technology and exceptional people together to operate in markets around the world. We value autonomy and the ability to quickly pivot to capture opportunities, so we operate using our own capital and trading at our own risk.

Headquartered in Chicago with offices throughout the U.S., Canada, Europe, and Asia, we trade a variety of asset classes including Fixed Income, ETFs, Equities, FX, Commodities and Energy across all major global markets. We have also leveraged our expertise and technology to expand into three non-traditional strategies: real estate, venture capital and cryptoassets.

We operate with respect, curiosity and open minds. The people who thrive here share our belief that itâ€™s not just what we do that mattersâ€“it's how we do it. DRW is a place of high expectations, integrity, innovation and a willingness to challenge consensus.

As a Data Analyst you will play an integral role in all operational aspects of onboarding, managing and maintaining various datasets used by traders and quantitative researchers. You will work closely with a variety of stakeholders, including technology, front office, operations, research, and risk management. You should be comfortable investigating complex data support issues in a fast-paced environment

What You Will Do In This Role


Help verify, clean, and ensure data is accurate and consistent across systems used for research and analysis by the various trading teams globally
Analyse datasets in order to draw conclusions and provide insight to address stakeholder or project-related questions
Collect metrics and analyse datasets across different dimensions of data quality including; completeness, validity, accuracy, timeliness, and consistency
Perform preliminary root cause analysis of data quality issues
Monitor and work through production data issues whilst engaging key stakeholders across multiple teams and facilitating global support
Assist the wider team by identifying opportunities for improving existing data pipelines


What You Will Need In This Role


Knowledge of a variety of financial instruments, in particular exposure to derivatives instruments
Experience working with SQL
Experience with cloud storage solutions
Prior experience documenting complex processes. Ideally some exposure to Confluence
Python programming skills: PySpark, Pandas, Jupyter Notebooks
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment; strong communication skills are desirable


Additional skills or experience which enhance consideration for this role


Prior experience developing data quality checks using Python
Familiarity with compressed/optimized file formats for data storage such as Parquet and HDF5
Prior experience working with Bloomberg Terminal
Familiarity with Linux and basic Bash scripting skills
Prior experience working with version control software
Experience with workflow management tools (Airflow / Argo)


For more information about DRW's processing activities and our use of job applicants' data, please view our Privacy Notice at https://drw.com/privacy-notice.

California residents, please review the California Privacy Notice for information about certain legal rights at https://drw.com/california-privacy-notice.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The role

NatureMetrics is a global leader in biodiversity monitoring and environmental DNA (eDNA) analysis, transforming the scale at which nature can be quantified. Our cutting-edge solutions enable organisations to monitor nature impact across sectors, from conservation to industry and inform sustainability decisions with unprecedented accuracy. With a strong market leading position, NatureMetrics has established a robust client base and developed a proprietary software platform that makes biodiversity insights accessible, actionable and scalable. As Earthshot Prize Finalists 2024, BloombergNEF Pioneers 2024, World Economic Forum Technology Pioneers 2024 and TechNation Future Fifty 2025 cohort members, we have the potential and the opportunity to change the way organisations operate.

As we grow, we're looking for a Data Analyst to take the lead on analytical work that helps teams across the business make better, data-informed decisions.

In this role, youâ€™ll own analysis projects from start to finish, build clear and useful reports and dashboards, help prioritise analytics work and support the development of our internal data tools and infrastructure. Youâ€™ll also play a key part in improving data literacy across the company.

Itâ€™s a hands-on, cross-functional role where youâ€™ll collaborate with people across commercial, product, scientific and technical teams and have the chance to shape how data is used across the organisation.

Key Responsibilities

Leading data analysis: Take the lead on analysis projects from scoping to delivery, supporting teams across the business, including commercial, product, science, operations and finance.

Managing analytics priorities: Work with different teams to understand their data needs, help set priorities and keep things aligned with overall business goals.

Building reports and dashboards: Develop internal reporting processes and build insightful dashboards using modern visualisation tools to give teams the information they need, when they need it.

Championing data literacy and best practice: Help colleagues across the business feel confident using data by sharing knowledge, offering support and establishingbest practices in data analysis.

Improving data infrastructure: Work with the data engineering team to build and maintain robust, well-structured data pipelines and help shape our internal data tools by promoting good practices around data quality, documentation and automation.

Collaborating with data science and machine learning team: Support exploratory data analysis to help validate hypotheses and inform the delivery of NatureMetrics' AI and machine learning roadmap.

About You

Weâ€™re looking for someone whoâ€™s curious, thrives in a collaborative, cross functional environment, and has a genuine interest in how businesses operate and how data can be used to make better decisions.

You Will Bring


Prior experience as a data analyst working independently within a commercial organisation.
Proficiency in using SQL and Python for data analysis.
Experience working with cloud platforms, ideally Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and BigQuery.
Familiarity with modern data visualisation tools (e.g. Looker, Metabase, Power BI or similar).
Knowledge of software development best practices such as version control (Git), code testing, and documentation.
An understanding of data engineering workflows and principles (e.g. modelling data assets, data orchestration, ETL/ELT processes).
Awareness of data science and machine learning workflows is desirable.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to distill complex ideas for diverse audiences.
A collaborative mindset and a desire to work cross-functionally across a purpose-driven business.


Desirable But Not Required


Experience working with software as a service (SaaS) products.
Familiarity with bioinformatics, life sciences or geospatial data.
Experience with CRM or ERP systems.


What's In It For You


Competitive Salary
Impactful work with a purpose-driven team
Flexible work arrangements
Opportunities for professional growth
Benefits package including salary sacrifice pension scheme prioritising sustainability; life assurance; Health insurance; Enhanced annual leave; Cycle to Work Scheme; enhanced family friendly policy.


Why us?

At NatureMetrics diversity and inclusion are part of our DNA. Together, we continue to build an inclusive culture that encourages, supports, and celebrates the diverse voices of our employees. It fuels our innovation and connects us to the communities we work with. Our values leave no space for stereotypes. We are all unique and pull together for a common purpose.

About Us

Backed by ambitious investors, we're on a mission to make biodiversity measurable at scale to underpin global goals and accelerate finance into nature. NatureMetrics combines tech and AI to derive simple insights from the full complexity of nature on the ground.

We're a dynamic team passionate about nature and biodiversity and we take immense pride in our work and our impact. Join us on this journey!
Show more

Title: Advanced Analytics & Reporting Analyst
Description:
Advanced Analytics & Reporting Analyst

Middlesex offices/Home - hybrid working 3 days PW in the office

Salary negotiable dep on experience Â£40,000 - 50,000

Job Reference - J12959




Please note this client cannot offer visa sponsorship so all applicants must have full and indefinite right to work in the UK.




Fantastic opportunity for a graduate with 2 yearsâ€™ proven commercial application experience in an Analyst role to join a highly respected global company.

We are seeking a bright graduate with a minimum of 2 years post university experience in an analytical role using SQL. Data visualisation skills using Tableau/PowerBI/Excel is also essential, any consulting or modelling experience is desirable. Degrees such as Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, MORSE, Economics, Data Science etc.




You should have a strong enthusiasm for problem solving and a passion for data. You will be expected to provide analytical expertise, seek to identify data gaps and proactively develop the data agenda in line with business priorities as well as challenge business leaders to become truly data driven. A positive thinker with plenty of curiosity would be ideal for this role.




Good communication skills are a must along with ambition and hunger to develop




Duties

â€¢ Structure problems and design and develop numerical models to inform decisions

â€¢ Proactively consult and bring together multiple stakeholders and gain buy-in to ideas and approaches

â€¢ Provide deep insight for critical business questions using a variety of analytical tools e.g. SQL, Tableau, Python and Excel




Skills

â€¢ Proven advanced analytical skills

â€¢ Comfortable challenging and influencing senior management with conflicting views

â€¢ Creativity in recommending solutions and commitment to driving delivery

â€¢ Proven ability to lead the direction of analytical projects

â€¢ Excellent presentation and communication skills

â€¢ Strong business acumen and commercial awareness

â€¢ Proven technical skills including SQL, Excel and Python (or similar)

â€¢ Experience in design and creation of data visualisations and dashboards e.g. Tableau




Qualifications

Experience

â€¢ Analysing complex issues, packaging findings and presenting effectively to stakeholders

â€¢ Managing databases and/or blending data

â€¢ Designing data for management information purposes

â€¢ Visualising data and presenting trends and findings for broad audiences
