Title: Business Intelligence Engineer, P2 Science, Data, and Insights
Description:
Description

Are you looking for a role where you have the opportunity to shape Amazonâ€™s Pricing and Promotions using data, analytics, and insights? If so, our role in Amazon's Pricing & Promotions Science, Data, and Insights organization is for you.

Amazon's Pricing & Promotions Science, Data, and Insights organization is seeking a highly analytical Business Intelligence Engineer. In this role, you will develop, build, and deliver automated analytics, insights, and anomaly detection tools and technologies, which will deliver the best prices and experiences to our customers. Data, insights, and analytics are at the core of Amazonâ€™s culture, and your work will have a direct impact on decision making and strategy for the Pricing and Promotions organization.

This role requires a hands-on engineer, with high learn and be curious, that is able to invest, simplify, and deliver for their customers. We are looking for a person with broad analytical abilities, that is customer and delivery-focused, and a has a track record of earning your customers and peerâ€™s trust. To be successful in this role, you will need strong business intelligence experience and an entrepreneurial mindset.

Key job responsibilities


Support business intelligence for your business and its customers.
Develop, build, and deliver analytical reporting, models and business strategy
Conduct deep dive analyses of business problems and formulate conclusions and recommendations to be presented to senior leadership.
Leverage LLMs to generate Insights and drive growth discussions with Product teams.
Produce written recommendations and insights for key stakeholders that will help shape effective metric development and reporting.
Continuously invent, simplify, and automate your products, tools, services, and methodologies.
Improving back-end data sources for increased accuracy and simplicity.
Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting, analyses, data quality and modeling.


About The Team

The Pricing & Promotions Science organization leverages planet scale multi-modal data on billions of Amazons and external competitor products to build advanced machine learning models for product similarity, substitutability, error detection & correction, and probabilistic price estimation, discovery and discount optimization, promotion & deal recommendation and ranking, and causal short- & long-term impact measurement. We preserve long term customer trust by ensuring Amazon's prices are always competitive and error free.

Basic Qualifications


3+ years of analyzing and interpreting data with Redshift, Oracle, NoSQL etc. experience
Experience working as a BIE in a technology company
Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools
Experience with data modeling, warehousing and building ETL pipelines
Experience in Statistical Analysis packages such as R, SAS and Matlab
Experience developing and presenting recommendations of new metrics allowing better understanding of the performance of the business
Experience using SQL to pull data from a database or data warehouse and scripting experience (Python) to process data for modeling
Bachelors Degree


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with AWS solutions such as EC2, DynamoDB, S3, and Redshift
Experience in data mining, ETL, etc. and using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets


Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region youâ€™re applying in isnâ€™t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

The base salary for this position ranges from $76,400/year up to $127,600/year. Salary is based on a number of factors and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

Title: Quantitative Equity Analyst â€“ Data Science
Description:
Quantitative Equity Analyst â€“ Data Science

Connor, Clark & Lunn Investment Management Ltd.

Vancouver, BC

We are looking for a Quantitative Equity Analyst to join our Quantitative Equity Team! We are a high-performance team embedded in a top-performing quant fund, dedicated to the mission-critical operation of our investment engineâ€”a well-tuned machine responsible for generating key decisions that drive trades and investment insights. Leveraging finance skills and cutting-edge technology, we ensure data quality, continuous process improvement, and operational excellence.

As a core member of our team, you'll collaborate with investment experts to tackle challenging analytical problems, be accountable to ensure accurate and timely trade generation, and drive operational innovation. Based in West Coast Vancouver, we value mentorship, collaboration, and growth in a supportive and innovative environment. Join us to make a significant impact on our investment engine and overall success.

What You Will Do

This is an exciting full-time role for individuals who are passionate about learning the quantitative equity investment management business and excited to tackle a broad range of investment, mathematical, and technology challenges.

You will start with a comprehensive training program, learning about various elements of quantitative equity investment management and our investment process.

You will then continue to a specialized role utilizing data science and process engineering skillsets to accelerate the Quantitative Equities Teamâ€™s various investment functions. Your specialized role may involve building, scaling, managing and/or analyzing our quantitative model, portfolios, data assets and optimizers.

You will be supported with coaching and mentorship from senior members of the team.

We are creating the conditions for you to grow your career steadily over time.

Investment Process Management

The team you will be joining is our Investment Process Management (IPM) group within our Quantitative Equities Team. IPM plays a central role in building highly scalable, efficient, and robust process management systems. The processes and infrastructure we maintain are critical in the teamâ€™s ability to develop systematic investment insights and generate daily trades to capture these insights in portfolios. The opportunity within the IPM group allows ambitious individuals to drive their career growth within IPM, or across the other functions of the Quantitative Equities Team in Research, Portfolio Construction, or Trading.

Skills

While we take the approach of tailoring the career path for the individual, we have found our functions to cover two main overarching technical skillsets:

Data Science


Construct and run algorithms to explore and assess data effectively.
Validate structured and unstructured data sets for data quality.
Design and test data loaders and security matching processes and specifications.
Perform data analysis and provide data expertise to support researcherâ€™s projects.
Facilitate production machine learning operational pipelines with effective and timely auditing and analysis.
Enable accessibility and clarity within our data assets through robust documentation and data scrubbing.
Develop robust methodologies for assessing and analyzing data in time critical production environments.
Respond to and mitigate vendor data issues effectively in a production setting.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate traditional and alternative data into existing analytical frameworks and decision-making processes.
Present findings and recommendations to key stakeholders in a clear, concise, and compelling manner.


Process and Reliability Engineering


Design, implement and test production processes to run the alpha and risk, portfolio optimization and market implementation processes.
Design robust, high performance and effective process orchestration.
Monitor production health and respond to critical issues in a timely manner.
Effectively communicate real-time production issues to portfolio managers, traders and researchers.
Identify computational bottle necks and improve run speeds in production systems.
Collaborate with investment teams to ensure their process needs are being met.
Find and evaluate areas for process improvements.
Assess and evaluate data quality of production processes.
Maintain process repos, clean code and tools within production processes.


Reasons to Grow Your Career with Us


Impact â€“ We help create opportunities for you to leverage your personal strengths to make a positive impact on our business.
Culture â€“ Collaboration and innovation are deeply rooted in our culture. We enjoy working together and align our passions in pursuit of a shared objective in every project we undertake.
Development â€“ We create conditions for success tailored to each employee through internally developed career development plans.
Mentorship â€“ We believe that developing great people is the key to great success. You will have opportunities to share, hear and learn about career experiences from peers and senior team members.
Work-Life Balance â€“ Vancouver is surrounded by water, mountains, and cherry blossoms. We work hard in our professional lives but also create space to enjoy our personal lives.


What You Bring


Analytical Mindset â€“ You think critically and creatively and are adept at balancing intuition with statistical validation.
Financial Knowledge â€“ You possess a thorough understanding of (or strong desire to learn) key drivers of business success, including financial theory, economic models, and corporate financial statements.
Self-Starter â€“ You are motivated and willing to take personal accountability for quality and timeliness of work.
Collaborative Approachâ€¯â€“ You thrive in a collaborative environment and value shared success. You proactively solicit and provide input and excel at communicating complex and technical concepts.
Time Management â€“ You have the ability to manage and prioritize multiple ongoing projects and daily responsibilities.
Academic Training â€“ At a minimum, an undergraduate degree in finance, mathematics, statistics, computer science, engineering, or related discipline. Completion of CFA or relevant graduate degree is considered an asset.
Industry Experience â€“ You haveâ€¯a passion for quantitative finance, equity investment, data science or related fields.


About Connor, Clark & Lunn Investment Management

Connor, Clark & Lunn Investment Management is a global institutional asset management firm established in 1982 and based in Vancouver, Canada. Our strong, stable team of investment professionals manages a broad range of investment solutions that includes traditional mandates such as developed and emerging market equities and fixed income, as well as alternative strategies such as portable alpha, market neutral and absolute return.

Connor, Clark & Lunn Investment Management Ltd. is part of the Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group Ltd. (CC&L Financial Group), a multi-boutique investment management company whose affiliates collectively manage over $139 billion in financial assets. Our affiliation with the CC&L Financial Group allows us to best deliver on the mission to provide superior performance and service to our clients.

Connor, Clark & Lunn Investment Management is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation or expression, disability, or age.

We welcome applications from candidates with different levels of experience, including interns, new graduates, and experienced professionals. The base salary range is $90,000 â€“ $200,000 annually plus a competitive performance bonus. Compensation will be determined based on experience and qualifications.

To apply for this position, please submit your resume, cover letter and academic transcripts.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. No telephone calls or agencies will be accepted. Successful applicants must be eligible to work in Canada on their start date.

Title: Global Brand Insights Senior Analyst
Description:
Requirements

Description & Requirements

who we are

lululemon is an innovative performance apparel company for yoga, running, training, and other athletic pursuits. Setting the bar in technical fabrics and functional design, we create transformational products and experiences that support people in moving, growing, connecting, and being well. We owe our success to our innovative product, emphasis on stores, commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we make in every community we're in. As a company, we focus on creating positive change to build a healthier, thriving future. In particular, that includes creating an equitable, inclusive and growth-focused environment for our people.

About This Team


The Global Brand Insights team is a trusted partner in the development of long and short-range brand, community, and guest experience strategies. Our team enables brand, community, impact, and guest experience strategy development through the design, management, execution, analysis, synthesis, and delivery of consumer, competitive and cultural global insights.
Key activities for our team include conducting primary (qualitative and quantitative) and secondary research to understand the behaviours, perceptions, values, and attitudes of lululemonâ€™s current and potential global guests, brand equity across global markets, and developing, refining and evaluating the performance of brand and community initiatives.


a day in the life: what youâ€™ll do

The Global Brand Insights Senior Analyst will be responsible for leading critical Global Brand Marketing Measurement programs, including Global Brand Lift Studies, Quantitative and Qualitative Creative Testing, and other ad-hoc and syndicated campaign development and brand measurement initiatives. The Senior Analyst will also support on various other brand insights initiatives.

The Global Brand Insights Senior Analyst is crucial in supporting the powerful delivery of insights to inform and evaluate lululemonâ€™s marketing strategies and initiatives.

Responsibilities


Lead the end-to-end delivery of campaign and creative research, and brand lift measurement, including internal discovery and intake, screener/questionnaire/ discussion guide design, data analysis, and reporting.
Partner with Global and Regional Marketing, Media, and Insights teams (i.e., social analytics, digital analytics, CRM, etc.) to provide a holistic evaluation of campaigns, identifying short- and long-term opportunities.
Create inspiring reports with compelling visualizations, a clear narrative, and meaningful and actionable insights, implications and recommendations for lululemonâ€™s Brand, Creative and Media teams.
Leverage existing data to support in the development of campaign KPIs and targets.
Lead the development and refinement of internal templates and processes to expedite creative testing and campaign evaluation reporting.
Beyond campaign evaluation, provide quantitative and qualitative support to Global Brand Insights teamâ€™s mixed method research studies.
Leverage and synthesize insights from a large and diverse range of primary and secondary market research sources to support across Global Brand Insights project needs.
Stay up to date on consumer and industry trends to surface up fresh insights and strategic implementations as it relates to the category and consumer.
Stay up to date on latest creative testing and marketing measurement methodologies.
Work cross-functionally with internal teams to ensure insights are well-rounded and brought to life in a way that both validates and inspires.


Qualifications


4-6 years of relevant market research and analytics experience.
Extensive experience designing, executing, and analyzing complex quantitative and qualitative market research studies.
Proven project management expertise, with a proven ability to lead and coordinate complex, multi-faceted projects from inception to completion.
In-depth understanding of the mechanics of media measurement and research, and familiarity with media strategies. Experience with MMMs considered an asset.
Strong track record of developing and maintaining strong working relationships with external market research vendors to execute research studies locally and internationally.
Proficient in leveraging custom quantitative survey tools (e.g., Alida, Alchemer, Qualtrics) to design research (questionnaire development, scripting, link testing), analyze data, and generate insights and reports.
Strong quantitative reasoning and analytical skills.
Strong storyteller with the ability to transform data into clear and compelling information through effective analytical, visualization, and report writing capabilities. Capable of communicating complex insights and data across different audiences and varying levels of the organization.
Youâ€™re naturally curious and love problem solving - you enjoy getting to the core of an issue through investigation and analysis, and you can take data to insights and ultimately to action.
Proven ability collaborating with others â€“ teamwork makes the dream work. Experience working efficiently with stakeholders and team members across time zones and countries.
Strong interest in market research, advertising, media and cultural trends, with a keen eye on how these elements shape consumer behavior and brand strategy.
Youâ€™re proactive, with a keen attention to detail.
Ability to juggle changing priorities while maintaining a positive attitude in the face of challenging deliverables.


must haves


Acknowledge the presence of choice in every moment and take personal responsibility for your life.
Possess an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovate to achieve great results.
Communicate with honesty and kindness and create the space for others to do the same.
Lead with courage, knowing the possibility of greatness is bigger than the fear of failure.
Foster connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships.
Integrate fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesnâ€™t take yourself too seriously.


Additional Notes

Authorization to work in Canada is required for this role.

Compensation And Benefits Package

lululemonâ€™s compensation offerings are grounded in a pay-for-performance philosophy that recognizes exceptional individual and teamâ€¯performance. Theâ€¯typical hiring range for this position is fromâ€¯$81,500-$107,000 CAD annually; the base pay offered is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and internal equity. As part of our total rewards offering, permanent employees in this position may be eligible for our competitive annual bonus program, subject to program eligibility requirements. â€¯

At Lululemon, Investing In Our People Is a Top Priority. We Believe That When Life Works, Work Works. We Strive To Be The Place Where Inclusive Leaders Come To Develop And Enable All To Be Well. Recognizing Our Teams For Their Performance And Dedication, Other Components Of Our Total Rewards Offerings Include Support Of Career Development, Wellbeing, And Personal Growth


Extended health and dental benefits, and mental health plans
Paid time off
Savings and retirement plan matching
Generous employee discount
Fitness & yoga classes
Parenthood top-up
Extensive catalog of development course offerings
People networks, mentorship programs, and leadership series (to name a few)


Note: The incentive programs, benefits, and perks have certain eligibility requirements. The Company reserves the right to alter these incentive programs, benefits, and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice.

workplace arrangement

In-person collaboration and connection is important to our culture. Work is performed onsite, minimum 4 days per week.

Title: Data Annotator (No Prior Experience Needed)
Description:
Work Location: Remote/work from home

Workload: Preferably 20 hours per week or more

Engagement Model: Freelance/Independent contractor

Language Needed: English

Project Duration: Until the end of June 2025




DataForce by TransPerfect is looking for English Annotators with excellent writing skills and attention to detail to be part of an innovative project related to Artificial Intelligence.




ROLE DESCRIPTION

As an annotator, you will be responsible for listening to short English audio recordings to generate detailed, accurate, and creative descriptions of human speech attributes (such as voice characteristics, delivery style-tone, speed, intonation, pace, pronunciation, apparent gender, age range, or accent, etc.).




Job requirements

Idiomatic fluency in English.
Excellent writing and spelling/grammar skills in English.
Ability to work independently and meet deadlines effectively.
Ability to follow detailed project guidelines.
Exceptional attention to detail and the ability to deliver error-free work.
Availability to work a minimum of 20 hours per week.
Familiarity with annotation/transcription online tools is preferred.




DataForce by TransPerfect is part of the TransPerfect family of companies, the worldâ€™s largest provider of language and technology solutions for global business, with offices in more than 100 cities worldwide.

We offer high-quality data for Human-Machine Interaction to some of the most prestigious technology companies in the world. Our department focuses on gathering, enriching and processing data for Machine Learning in different AI domains.

To learn more about DataForce please visit us at https://www.transperfect.com/dataforce

Title: Senior Manager, Business Intelligence
Description:
Position: Sr Manager, Business Intelligence

Department: Business Intelligence

Reports to: VP, Ticket & Premium Sales & Service

Position Summary

The Sr Manager, Business Intelligence (BI) will lead Canucks Sports & Entertainment (CSE) into an era of data-driven decisions across the enterprise. As the leader of the BI team, this role will set data strategy, build trust across CSE's leadership team, and work tirelessly to bring data-driven insights to all that we do.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

(Other duties may be assigned as required)


Set a strategy for using data to drive intelligent decisions and ultimately improve effectiveness and profitability
Work with leaders from all CSE departments to understand challenges and ensure adoption of data and analytics across the business
Be a key player in strategy development and decisions by identifying, evaluating, and presenting data and analytics and creating actionable insights
Build and manage the end-to-end analytics and business intelligence platform for ticket and premium sales, corporate partnerships, marketing, retail, quick service and other departments at CSE
Drive data driven business decisions amongst CSE business properties and effectively communicate findings and recommendations with department heads on the revenue team
Work with ticket sales and marketing on paid advertising effectiveness through segmentation, messaging, and testing
Optimize pricing for each business segment for CSE, inclusive of ticketing, premium, corporate partnerships, retail, food & beverage, etc.
Demonstrate quantifiable partnerships value to prospects and current partners
Create actionable insights and understandings through the analysis of both quantitative and qualitative data, building recommendations that directly address organizational goals
Manage a team of analysts and data scientists who provide regular and ad hoc analyses to all relevant internal teams
Lead full scale analyses to better understand growth trends and business performance
Stay up to date with all CSE brand studies and fan sentiment research
Work with other team leaders in the development of new revenue streams and A/B testing of various products and sales strategies
Coordinate with other NHL Clubs and NHL League staff to ensure access to all relevant data and league trends
Hire, lead, mentor, and develop BI staff


REQUIRED Experience & Qualifications


Experience in a BI or analytics role with a professional sports team or league
Proven track record of using data and analytics to drive incremental revenue and meet other organizational goals and objectives
Proven ability to communicate analytical findings and related strategic recommendations clearly to senior management across different teams and areas of expertise
Strong quantitative and financial modeling skills, including exposure to SQL and relational databases
Strong proficiency with Excel, including ability to build complex spreadsheet models, run pivots, macros, v-lookups, and other advanced functions
Experience with data visualization tools
Ability to deliver both detail-oriented analyses and strategic recommendations
Ability to develop analytical approach to issues and questions presented, and to see processes through from issue presentation to strategic recommendation
Onsite role at our office in downtown Vancouver
Demonstrated ability to design and implement statistical models in Python and R is an asset


Vancouver is one of the most diverse cities in the world and Canucks Sports & Entertainment strives to create a workforce that is inclusive, equitable, and represents our beautiful, unique community. We value unique perspectives, ideas, and creativity that support a diverse, inclusive, respectful, collaborative, and fun work environment. Canucks Sports & Entertainment is committed to building and supporting a diverse team.

This position will remain open until filled.

HTML:
Position: Sr Manager, Business Intelligence

Department: Business Intelligence

Reports to: VP, Ticket & Premium Sales & Service

Position Summary

The Sr Manager, Business Intelligence (BI) will lead Canucks Sports & Entertainment (CSE) into an era of data-driven decisions across the enterprise. As the leader of the BI team, this role will set data strategy, build trust across CSE's leadership team, and work tirelessly to bring data-driven insights to all that we do.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

(Other duties may be assigned as required)

  • Set a strategy for using data to drive intelligent decisions and ultimately improve effectiveness and profitability
  • Work with leaders from all CSE departments to understand challenges and ensure adoption of data and analytics across the business
  • Be a key player in strategy development and decisions by identifying, evaluating, and presenting data and analytics and creating actionable insights
  • Build and manage the end-to-end analytics and business intelligence platform for ticket and premium sales, corporate partnerships, marketing, retail, quick service and other departments at CSE
  • Drive data driven business decisions amongst CSE business properties and effectively communicate findings and recommendations with department heads on the revenue team
  • Work with ticket sales and marketing on paid advertising effectiveness through segmentation, messaging, and testing
  • Optimize pricing for each business segment for CSE, inclusive of ticketing, premium, corporate partnerships, retail, food & beverage, etc.
  • Demonstrate quantifiable partnerships value to prospects and current partners
  • Create actionable insights and understandings through the analysis of both quantitative and qualitative data, building recommendations that directly address organizational goals
  • Manage a team of analysts and data scientists who provide regular and ad hoc analyses to all relevant internal teams
  • Lead full scale analyses to better understand growth trends and business performance
  • Stay up to date with all CSE brand studies and fan sentiment research
  • Work with other team leaders in the development of new revenue streams and A/B testing of various products and sales strategies
  • Coordinate with other NHL Clubs and NHL League staff to ensure access to all relevant data and league trends
  • Hire, lead, mentor, and develop BI staff

REQUIRED Experience & Qualifications

  • Experience in a BI or analytics role with a professional sports team or league
  • Proven track record of using data and analytics to drive incremental revenue and meet other organizational goals and objectives
  • Proven ability to communicate analytical findings and related strategic recommendations clearly to senior management across different teams and areas of expertise
  • Strong quantitative and financial modeling skills, including exposure to SQL and relational databases
  • Strong proficiency with Excel, including ability to build complex spreadsheet models, run pivots, macros, v-lookups, and other advanced functions
  • Experience with data visualization tools
  • Ability to deliver both detail-oriented analyses and strategic recommendations
  • Ability to develop analytical approach to issues and questions presented, and to see processes through from issue presentation to strategic recommendation
  • Onsite role at our office in downtown Vancouver
  • Demonstrated ability to design and implement statistical models in Python and R is an asset

Vancouver is one of the most diverse cities in the world and Canucks Sports & Entertainment strives to create a workforce that is inclusive, equitable, and represents our beautiful, unique community. We value unique perspectives, ideas, and creativity that support a diverse, inclusive, respectful, collaborative, and fun work environment. Canucks Sports & Entertainment is committed to building and supporting a diverse team.

This position will remain open until filled.

Title: Business Intelligence Engineer II - American Football
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

We evolve our games and how players interact with them by using the power of data to continuously uncover insights to deliver an even better player experience. We strive to be the best-in-class AI team in the gaming industry by maximizing the fun for EA players through easier deployment of AI-driven solutions for game makers. Our insights are ubiquitous through autonomous analytics.

At Electronic Arts, we exist to inspire the world to play. We are looking for an accomplished Business Intelligence Engineer. You will report to the Director of Business Intelligence. We believe in creating an inclusive world inside and outside of our games for our players and our team. As a geo-diverse team, our team members around the globe can either work from home, in the office or a hybrid of both. You will develop dashboard-based solutions we have today while prototyping the AI-infused solutions of tomorrow. You will also stay informed of the latest tech and research on all aspects of BI and Analytics and will have experience delivering complex projects, including broad decision-making on technical decisions and implementation.

Responsibilities


You will develop automated reporting to promote data-driven decisions across the team and with partner teams.
You will contribute to the full development lifecycle, from idea generation to implementation, ensuring understanding of industry best practices
You will gather requirements, model and design solutions to support decision-making and data maturity
You will work with analysts, product managers, data architects and designers to understand requirements, and help develop interactive Power BI dashboards
You will support the process of adoption of new technologies and applications we use to integrate analytical solutions.
You will develop interactive dashboards and other self-service tools, backed by semantic data models
You will develop quality operational analytics BI products that extend support to Development Operations and Technical Leads, enhancing consistency and efficiency across franchises.


Qualifications


5+ years of relevant industry experience in BI engineering/report development
Proficiency in writing advanced, performant SQL/DAX queries.
Experience in UI/UX design principles and able to give design opinions and recommendations.
Well versed in consuming large enterprise data sets.
Experience using alternative or custom data sources within Power BI (ex. REST APIs).
Team player, initiative taker.
Experience in any cloud environment (AWS, Azure, GCP).


Beneficial to Have


Knowledge and passion for video games.
Experience working with unstructured datasets.
Experience in the physical and logical design of database architecture for relational databases, data warehouses and data lakes.
Web development experience (HTML, React).
Power BI Service experience
Nice to have experience with with Python programming language
Exposure to creating data pipelines.


Ceci ne sâ€™applique pas au QuÃ©bec.

Compensation And Benefits

The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs).

PAY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria) * $96,400 - $133,900 CAD
California (depending on location e.g. Los Angeles vs. Sacramento) * $122,300 - $170,600 USD
Colorado (depending on location e.g. Denver vs. Colorado Springs) * $111,800 - $151,800 USD
Illinois (depending on location e.g. Chicago vs Illinois City) *$104,000 - $138,700 USD
Minnesota (depending on location e.g. Minneapolis vs Saint Paul) *$104,000 - $138,700 USD
Jersey City, NJ * $137,300 - $170,600 USD
New York (depending on location e.g. Manhattan vs. Buffalo) * $104,000 - $170,600 USD
Washington (depending on location e.g. Seattle vs. Spokane) * $104,000 - $174,700 USD


Base salary is just one part of the overall compensation at EA. In the US, we offer a package of benefits including paid time off (3 weeks per year to start), 80 hours per year of sick time, 16 paid company holidays per year, 10 weeks paid time off to bond with baby, medical/dental/vision insurance, life insurance, disability insurance, and 401(k) to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity. For British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

About Electronic Arts

Weâ€™re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Title: Business Intelligence Intern - Fall 2025 Co-op
Description:
Definity is the parent company to some of Canadaâ€™s most long-standing and innovative insurance brands, including Economical Insurance, Sonnet Insurance, Family Insurance Solutions, and Petline Insurance. Our ambition is to be one of Canadaâ€™s leading and most innovative property and casualty insurers. We canâ€™t do that without our people, so we embrace and encourage a culture thatâ€™s collaborative, ambitious, rewarding, and empowering.

We offer a flexible, hybrid work experience where employees work from the office and virtually depending on the type of work they are doing and who they are working with. Bring your true self and be a part of our journey. Itâ€™s better here.

YOUR NEXT CO-OP PLACEMENT

Work term: Fall 2025

Work term length: 4-months or 8 months

From classroom to co-op to career, every step of your journey has an impact on your future. Thatâ€™s why it makes sense to choose a co-op placement with a company that offers truly rewarding work and real-life experience. At DefinityÂ®, your contributions, creativity, and energy will be put to good use, and youâ€™ll get to be involved with initiatives that support our strategic goals and use your skills in a supportive team environment.

If youâ€™re looking for a company that takes care of its people â€” full time, part time, and co-ops alike â€” and has a track record of doing big things, get ready to love it here.

About this role:

Reporting directly to the Director, Data Management, Analytics & BI, Business Intelligence Co-op Student will work closely with other team members to provide analysis, create reports and prepare recommendations for Family Insuranceâ€™s internal BI portal. Your daily activities will include identifying operational trends, analyzing data, and maintaining Familyâ€™s BI assets. You enjoy the challenge of creating a highly effective data visualization tool to drive business decisions

What Youâ€™ll Be Doing


Monitor and assess BI tickets on an ongoing basis.
Create business segmentation and analysis for Family's Insuranceâ€™s operations (e.g., by risk type, geographical attributes, and business channels) to identify business trends, anomalies and opportunities to enhance growth and profitability.
Develop and analyze financial assumptions used to measure business targets and goals by using various insurance and mathematical concepts (e.g., regression analysis).
Maintain data tables and assets in BI databases and in all other database environments, e.g., MIS, Development, and Quality Assurance.
Provide rating analysis support for all system projects involving changes to Family's proprietary rating engine, its business rules, and/or data tables; as well as supporting the programming, testing and implementation of Family's strategic rating.



What You Bring


Knowledge of any dashboard development tool (Tableau preferred).
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to assist the organization in improving performance and productivity
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and visual design skills.
Experience in Data Visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Excel and Microsoft SSRS.
Ability to take initiative, set deadlines and manage projects to a timely and successful conclusion.
Strong English written and verbal communication skills with the ability to explain complex concepts to stakeholders.
Strong organizational and time management skills.
Adaptable and able to manage change in a fast-paced and fluid environment
Team player who is professional, friendly and courteous in all interactions, whether with customers or co-workers.



We also take potential into consideration. If you donâ€™t have this exact experience, but you know you have what it takes, be sure to give us more insight through your application and cover letter.

Go ahead and expect a lot â€” you deserve it:

Did you know?


We care about our co-ops: Definityâ€™s co-op students are considered the best pipeline of talent for our full-time, permanent positions.â€¯
We care about students: Definity distributes $85,000 in scholarships to students across Canada each year.â€¯
We care about our community: Definity donates more than $1 million every year to causes that drive true change in the neighbourhoods in which we live and work.â€¯



What can Definity offer you?


Meaningful work forwarding our purpose of building a better world by helping our clients and communities adapt and thrive in their hardest times of need.
Culture of accountability, empowerment, and collaboration.
Opportunities to support personal and professional growth through real-life experience and unique learning opportunities. Our Leadership Essentials program builds knowledge and skills to Team Leaders to Directors
Opportunity to join our employee groups - focused on women's empowerment, LGBTQ+, anti-racism and cultural equity, and environmental activism
Determined to create positive change for our environment, our people, and our communities, now and in the future. Check our ESG work!

This role requires successful clearance of a background check (including criminal checks and leadership references).

Our ambition is to be one of Canadaâ€™s leading and most innovative property and casualty insurers. We canâ€™t do that without our people, so we embrace and encourage a culture thatâ€™s collaborative, ambitious, rewarding, and empowering.

We offer a flexible, hybrid work experience where employees work from the office and virtually depending on the type of work they are doing and who they are working with. Bring your true self and be a part of our journey. Itâ€™s better here.

YOUR NEXT CO-OP PLACEMENT

Work term: Fall 2025

Work term length: 4-months or 8 months

From classroom to co-op to career, every step of your journey has an impact on your future. Thatâ€™s why it makes sense to choose a co-op placement with a company that offers truly rewarding work and real-life experience. At DefinityÂ®, your contributions, creativity, and energy will be put to good use, and youâ€™ll get to be involved with initiatives that support our strategic goals and use your skills in a supportive team environment.

If youâ€™re looking for a company that takes care of its people â€” full time, part time, and co-ops alike â€” and has a track record of doing big things, get ready to love it here.

About this role:

Reporting directly to the Director, Data Management, Analytics & BI, Business Intelligence Co-op Student will work closely with other team members to provide analysis, create reports and prepare recommendations for Family Insuranceâ€™s internal BI portal. Your daily activities will include identifying operational trends, analyzing data, and maintaining Familyâ€™s BI assets. You enjoy the challenge of creating a highly effective data visualization tool to drive business decisions

What Youâ€™ll Be Doing

  • Monitor and assess BI tickets on an ongoing basis.
  • Create business segmentation and analysis for Family's Insuranceâ€™s operations (e.g., by risk type, geographical attributes, and business channels) to identify business trends, anomalies and opportunities to enhance growth and profitability.
  • Develop and analyze financial assumptions used to measure business targets and goals by using various insurance and mathematical concepts (e.g., regression analysis).
  • Maintain data tables and assets in BI databases and in all other database environments, e.g., MIS, Development, and Quality Assurance.
  • Provide rating analysis support for all system projects involving changes to Family's proprietary rating engine, its business rules, and/or data tables; as well as supporting the programming, testing and implementation of Family's strategic rating.


What You Bring

  • Knowledge of any dashboard development tool (Tableau preferred).
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills to assist the organization in improving performance and productivity
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and visual design skills.
  • Experience in Data Visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Excel and Microsoft SSRS.
  • Ability to take initiative, set deadlines and manage projects to a timely and successful conclusion.

  • Strong organizational and time management skills.

  • Team player who is professional, friendly and courteous in all interactions, whether with customers or co-workers.

Title: Project Analyst
Description:
Join us in our mission to commercialize fusion energy âš¡ï¸

Weâ€™re all about solving climate change through fusion energy, one stellarator at a time. Our impressive team of globally recognized fusion scientists along with veteran business leaders with experienced in scaling energy technologies, came together with the ambition to fulfill the bold decadal vision of commercial fusion.

If changing the world wasnâ€™t incentive enough, hereâ€™s why you should join us:

We designed, built, and operated the worldâ€™s leading stellarators.

We aim to commercialize fusion energy in 10 years.

We know what weâ€™re doing - our leadership team has over 150 years of experience combined.

Weâ€™ve already been recognised for our work by the Department of Energy through awards and funding.

Our philosophy accepts no intellectual boundaries and celebrates creativity.

Company: Type One Energy Group - Canada, Inc.

Job Title: Project Analyst

NOC: 11201 â€“ Professional occupations in business management consulting

Offered Wage: $43.00 â€“ 45.00/hour (based on a 40-hour workweek) - permanent/full-time

Work Location: 1140 West Pender St., Vancouver, BC V6E 4G1 Canada

Number of Positions: One (1)

Required Language Skills: English (spoken & written)

About Us

Type One Energy Group is mission-driven to provide sustainable, affordable fusion power to the world. Established in 2019 and venture-backed in 2023, the company is led by a team of globally recognized fusion scientists with a strong track record of building state-of-the-art stellarator fusion machines, together with veteran business leaders experienced in scaling companies and commercializing energy technologies. Type One Energy applies proven advanced manufacturing methods, modern computational physics and high-field superconducting magnets to develop its optimized stellarator fusion energy system.

Our FusionDirect development program pursues the lowest-risk, shortest-schedule path to a fusion power plant over the coming decade, using a partner-intensive and capital-efficient strategy. We are committed to diversity, inclusion, and equitable access to clean energy. For more information, visit www.typeoneenergy.com or follow us on LinkedIn.

Job Summary

The Project Analyst will play a pivotal role in supporting Type One Energy's mission to revolutionize energy production by managing complex projects within the fusion energy sector. The successful candidate will oversee project schedules, budgets, and risk management, leveraging data-driven insights to optimize project performance. This role requires advanced skills in automation, statistical analysis, and specialized project management tools, with a focus on driving operational efficiency and continuous improvement across multiple projects.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and maintain project schedules, budgets, and deliverables for complex, high-stakes projects within the fusion energy sector.
Create and manage risk registers, conduct FMEA risk assessments, and implement risk mitigation strategies using tools like LogicGate and RiskyProject.
Utilize advanced statistical methods and programming languages (e.g., Python, MATLAB, SQL) to analyze project data and optimize key performance metrics. Design custom dashboards in PowerBI for real-time project monitoring.
Automate project processes using tools such as Power Automate, PowerApps, and custom scripts (e.g., JavaScript/Apps Script/Power Fx). Develop automated systems for documentation, purchasing, and other operational workflows.
Configure and manage project management tools (e.g., Primavera P6, JIRA, Smartsheet) to meet project requirements and enhance team collaboration. Integrate these tools with platforms like Confluence and SharePoint.
Oversee the timecard system tailored to the organizationâ€™s needs. Ensure accurate and timely entry of employee work hours, monitor data quality, trouble soot discrepancies, and resolve issue promptly.
Develop and customize reports to meet specific departmental needs or management requests, such as cost tracking, schedule health check
Lead initiatives to improve project management processes, gather team feedback, and implement enhancements based on data analysis.


Required Skills

The successful candidate must have:


A minimum of 2 years of experience in the fusion energy sector or a related high-technology industry, with expertise in managing complex technical projects and understanding project management practices specific to engineering or energy-related fields.
At least 2 years of experience in advanced Excel, with expertise in data management and analysis, complex formulas and calculations, pivot tables and charts, data automation and Validation.
At least 2 years of experience using advanced project management software, including Primavera P6, JIRA, LogicGate, and Smartsheet, with demonstrated capability in configuring these tools to meet project requirements.
At least 2 years of experience in automating workflows using tools such as Power Automate, PowerApps, or custom scripts (e.g., JavaScript/Apps Script).
At least 2 years of experience in data analysis using programming languages like Python, MATLAB, or SQL, with proficiency in creating data visualization dashboards using PowerBI.
At least 2 years of experience in risk management, including performing FMEA risk assessments, developing risk mitigation strategies, and managing risk registers for high-stakes projects.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to lead process improvement initiatives and train team members on specialized tools and techniques.


Required Education


Bachelorâ€™s degree in Engineering, Project Management, Data Science, or a related field.


Benefits


Bonus (if applicable):
Disability Insurance
Dental Insurance
RRSP with up to 4% company match
Extended Medical Insurance (e.g. prescription drugs, paramedical services, medical services and equipment)
Vacation Days â€“ 12 Holidays & 15 Days PTO
Any additional benefits offered:
Company Shares

How To Apply

Please send your resume to the following email address: careers@typeoneenergy.com. We ask that the candidates put "Project Analyst" in the email subject line when they apply so that it's easily identifiable. We thank you for applying, however, only those selected to continue will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Statement

Type One Energy is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity, searching for the best new ideas and remaining open to unique perspectives. Therefore, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment independent of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age, or any other characteristics protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.

Type One Energy Group is mission-driven to provide sustainable, affordable fusion power to the world. The company was formed in 2019 by a team of globally-recognized fusion scientists with a strong track record of building state-of-art stellarator fusion machines, together with veteran business leaders experienced in scaling companies and commercializing energy technologies.

Type One Energy applies proven advanced manufacturing methods, modern computational physics and high-field superconducting magnets to develop its optimized stellarator fusion energy system. Its FusionDirect development program pursues the lowest-risk, shortest-schedule path to a fusion power plant over the coming decade, using a partner-intensive and capital-efficient strategy.

For more information, visit https://www.typeoneenergy.com/.

Title: Sr. Analyst, Media Effectiveness
Description:
Job Description:

Our mission is to Drive Business Performance by leveraging data to create personalized, connected experiences that deliver transformative business outcomes. We help our clients achieve their quantifiable business goals consistently, across every market. Our focus is entirely on delivering better business results through optimization, creation, and analysis across all digital platforms. Our work spans from recommending how to use content more effectively to optimizing daily media channel performance and maximizing visibility on eCommerce platforms.

About The Role

Dentsu Canada is looking to add a Senior Analyst, Media Effectiveness to support our evolving team. The ideal candidate will have experience in analytics within media, either at an agency, corporate environment, or media vendor. Familiarity with digital media concepts across Search, Social, Video, and Display is a plus. We value a willingness to learn, clear and confident communication skills, and out-of-the-box thinking. A strong media analytics background in media measurement and attribution, data visualization, automation, and strong presentation and client skills.

Responsibilities:


Analysis & Reporting
Develop and maintain automated reporting solutions across paid media platforms, web site and internal business data
Extract, transform, and analyze consumer data and marketing data to drive recommendations
Create compelling data visualizations and dashboards that effectively communicate media performance metrics
Connect marketing performance data to relevant site and business actions
Platform Expertise
Maintain deep knowledge of major paid media platforms, their data structures, and reporting capabilities
Experience with popular site analytics tools (GA4, Adobe Analytics) for integrated customer journey analysis
Stay current with platform updates, new features, and best practices
Technical Implementation
Build and maintain data pipelines for efficient processing of advertising data
Implement tracking solutions and ensure proper data collection across paid media and web touchpoints
Develop custom scripts and tools to automate routine tasks and enhance reporting capabilities
Configure platform integrations to create unified reporting views across the customer journey


Qualifications:


Proficient in SQL, Python, and/or R for data manipulation and analysis
Experience with Google Analytics
Hands-on experience with major paid media platforms and their APIs (Google Ads, Meta, LinkedIn, etc.)
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Python libraries
Experience with ETL processes and data pipeline development
Problem-solving mindset with attention to detail and data accuracy
2-3 years of experience in digital analytics, preferably in an agency environment with a focus on paid media



Nice-to-Have Skills:


Experience with data cleanroom environments (Amazon Marketing Cloud, Google Ads Data Hub, LiveRamp)
Knowledge of tag management systems (Google Tag Manager, Adobe Launch)
Familiarity with cross-channel attribution models and multi-touch conversion analysis
Experience with identity resolution and audience management platforms
Experience with A/B testing and experiment design for paid media
Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) for data processing
Experience with privacy-compliant data collection practices in a cookieless environment



Additional Information:

The salary range for this position is $65k-$75k. Actual salary within the salary range will be based on a variety of factors including relevant experience, knowledge, and skills. A range of medical, dental, RRSP, paid time off, and/or other benefits also are available to all permanent employees.

We know through experience that different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds foster a stronger and more creative work environment that delivers better business results. We strive to create workplaces that reflect the clients we serve and where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work. We are committed to working with our candidates from all ability levels throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Canada.Recruitment@dentsu.com or to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process.

Location:

Toronto

Brand:

Dentsu Media

Time Type:

Full time

Contract Type:

Permanent

Title: Senior Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Cymax Group Technologies is a leading eCommerce technology and logistics services platform for big & bulky vendors and retailers. We maximize the best of technology, automation, and AI to simplify the complexities of eCommerce through our two products - Channel Gate and Freight Club. We partner with vendors and retailers to tackle some of the industryâ€™s biggest challenges, offering prescriptive recommendations to optimize their ROI in a competitive market. Our remote-flexible team works to support our partners from the US and Canada.

About The Role

Are you passionate about turning complex data into clear, actionable insights? Do you thrive at the intersection of business strategy and analytics? Weâ€™re looking for a Senior Analyst to join our high-impact team and serve as the vital link between our business leaders and analytics experts.

As a trusted advisor to senior leadership, youâ€™ll uncover revenue and margin opportunities, shape strategic initiatives, and champion a culture of data-driven decision-making across the organization.

This is a hybrid role, based in the Vancouver, BC area.

What Youâ€™ll Do


ðŸ“Š Deliver Insights: Conduct deep-dive analyses to identify growth opportunities and optimize performance across the business. Deliver clear, concise analyses that uncover revenue and margin opportunities, and inform prioritization of strategic initiatives and marketing campaigns.
ðŸ—£ï¸ Tell the Story: Translate complex data into compelling, executive-ready narratives that influence high-level decision-making. Present to Senior Leadership level audiences and influence roadmaps for Product, Marketing, Vendor Management and Logistics.
ðŸ” Drive Change: Proactively identify gaps in and improvements in our business, continually advocating for optimization and advocate for data-based decision making throughout the organization, working with business owners throughout the organization to tackle complex problems using data and insights.
ðŸ¤ Mentor & Lead: Coach junior analysts and business partners on statistical rigor, code quality, and visualization. Champion a culture of experimentation, reproducible research, and continuous improvement.


What Weâ€™re Looking For

Experience & Education


7+ years in analytics or data science roles
3+ years in eCommerce or digital marketplaces


Technical Skills


Advanced SQL and experience with modern data warehouses
Proficient in Python or R for data wrangling, modeling, and visualization
Skilled in Power BI (or similar tools)
Deep understanding of eCommerce funnels, category & vendor management analytics, sales attribution, and marketing metrics.
Proven ability to distill complex analyses into stories for nonâ€‘technical stakeholders and influence decisions.
Bonus: Familiarity with machine learning techniques for recommendation and forecasting


Personal Attributes


Detail-oriented with excellent communication skills
Comfortable training both technical and non-technical audiences
Passionate about data, experimentation, and continuous learning


Why Join Us?


ðŸŒ Impact: Your work will directly influence strategic decisions at the highest levels.
ðŸ¤ Collaboration: Work alongside smart, driven colleagues who value data as much as you do.
ðŸ“ˆ Growth: Opportunities to lead, mentor, and shape the future of analytics in a fast-paced environment.


Compensation

The Salary Range for this role is between $90,000 and $120,000, depending on experience. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level and location. We offer a comprehensive range of benefits which includes:


Health and wellness support for our team members and their families including an employee assistance program
100% paid premiums for health and dental benefits in Canada
Paid time off
Easy access to online and phone-based counselling services
And a remote-flexible work environment.


Join Our AI Journey at Cymax Group!

At Cymax Group, we thrive on innovation and entrepreneurship. As an AI-first organization, we are on an exciting journey to continuously grow and evolve our focus on AI, empowering our people at all levels. Our fast-paced environment encourages agility and nimbleness, enabling our team to adapt swiftly to changing market dynamics. We're passionate about continuous learning and growth, offering opportunities for professional development. Our data-driven decision-making ensures we make informed choices that lead to success. If you're excited about making an impact and being part of a dynamic, AI-empowered team, you'll feel right at home here.

Join us and be part of a dynamic team that values innovation, collaboration, and excellence. Apply now to make a significant impact at Cymax Group Technologies!

Accessibility

We can provide accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Technical Skills

  • Advanced SQL and experience with modern data warehouses
  • Proficient in Python or R for data wrangling, modeling, and visualization
  • Skilled in Power BI (or similar tools)
  • Deep understanding of eCommerce funnels, category & vendor management analytics, sales attribution, and marketing metrics.
  • Proven ability to distill complex analyses into stories for nonâ€‘technical stakeholders and influence decisions.
  • Bonus: Familiarity with machine learning techniques for recommendation and forecasting

Personal Attributes

  • Detail-oriented with excellent communication skills
  • Comfortable training both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Passionate about data, experimentation, and continuous learning

Why Join Us?

  • ðŸŒ Impact: Your work will directly influence strategic decisions at the highest levels.
  • ðŸ¤ Collaboration: Work alongside smart, driven colleagues who value data as much as you do.
  • ðŸ“ˆ Growth: Opportunities to lead, mentor, and shape the future of analytics in a fast-paced environment.

Compensation

The Salary Range for this role is between $90,000 and $120,000, depending on experience. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level and location. We offer a comprehensive range of benefits which includes:

  • Health and wellness support for our team members and their families including an employee assistance program
  • 100% paid premiums for health and dental benefits in Canada
  • Paid time off
  • Easy access to online and phone-based counselling services
  • And a remote-flexible work environment.

Join Our AI Journey at Cymax Group!

At Cymax Group, we thrive on innovation and entrepreneurship. As an AI-first organization, we are on an exciting journey to continuously grow and evolve our focus on AI, empowering our people at all levels. Our fast-paced environment encourages agility and nimbleness, enabling our team to adapt swiftly to changing market dynamics. We're passionate about continuous learning and growth, offering opportunities for professional development. Our data-driven decision-making ensures we make informed choices that lead to success. If you're excited about making an impact and being part of a dynamic, AI-empowered team, you'll feel right at home here.

Join us and be part of a dynamic team that values innovation, collaboration, and excellence. Apply now to make a significant impact at Cymax Group Technologies!

Accessibility

We can provide accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Analyst, Sustainability
Description:
About QuadReal Property Group

QuadReal Property Group is a global real estate investment, operating and development company headquartered in Vancouver, British Columbia. Its assets under management are $94 billion. From its foundation in Canada as a full-service real estate operating company, QuadReal has expanded its capabilities to invest in equity and debt in both the public and private markets. QuadReal invests directly, via programmatic partnerships and through operating platforms in which it holds an ownership interest.

QuadReal seeks to deliver strong investment returns while creating sustainable environments that bring value to the people and communities it serves. Now and for generations to come.

QuadReal: Excellence lives here.

www.quadreal.com

Analyst, Sustainability

Vancouver, BC

Role Description

The Sustainability Analyst is an integral member of a highly collaborative team, working towards QuadRealâ€™s mandate to be a global sustainability leader. This position will support QuadRealâ€™s sustainability strategy in its key areas: environment, places and leading with integrity.

The Sustainability Analyst will work directly with QuadReal properties to review and analyze their energy and water consumption, with a focus on creating efficiencies and reducing waste. This individual will have a passion for mitigating climate change and a strong desire to support QuadReal on its sustainability journey.

Responsibilities


Assist QuadReal properties with setting energy, water and waste targets that drive down tenant costs and improve building performance on green certifications
Facilitate training sessions to educate property teams on the energy/sustainability management systems
Monitor and analyze QuadRealâ€™s cloud-based energy software to find opportunities for improvement and produce reports that highlight where additional emphasis and focus is needed
Support with annual reporting of utilities and GHGs for GRESB, TCFD, SASB
Support ISO 14001 certification of Environmental Management System
Coordinate property-level climate resilience assessments for all new acquisitions and develop risk assessments for existing portfolio
Actively support net zero carbon transition planning and tracking
Collaborate with other teams for incentive funding across the national portfolio
Provide overall support for other ad-hoc projects that are identified throughout the year


Experience And Qualifications


Two years of relevant experience in sustainability or analytics, along with working knowledge of utility data (energy, water, waste). Experience managing data and processes in an EMS (Energy Management System) is an asset
Undergraduate degree in a related discipline, such as environmental management, science, or engineering. Specialized coursework in statistics and science is preferred
Intermediate to advanced skills in Excel, Word, and other databases
Ability to develop and sustain cooperative working relationships and adapt to different communication styles
Willingness to learn and grow in a dynamic environment
Experience creating infographics highly preferred
Bilingualism is considered an asset


The expected annualized base salary range for this role is $65,000-75,000.

The actual salary offered will take into consideration a wide array of factors including, but not limited to, the individualâ€™s skill, experience, education and training, the market compensation of the role, and the consideration to internal equity.

QuadReal offers a competitive total rewards package in addition to the base pay, which includes a performance-based incentive plan, comprehensive health & dental benefits, a defined contribution pension plan and paid time off.

Note to Recruiters: QuadReal does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to QuadReal, directly or indirectly, will be considered QuadReal property. QuadReal will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for engaged services to submit resumes.

QuadReal Property Group will provide reasonable accommodation at any time throughout the hiring process for applicants with disabilities or for those needing job postings in an alternate format. If you require accommodation, please advise the Talent Acquisition team member you are working with and include the following: Job posting #, your name and your preferred method of contact.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer




8 month contract opportunity, high potential to extend




"Hybrid" work environment - 2 times per week in downtown Vancouver office




Seeking a Data Engineer who is passionate about big data technology and delivering data solution to handle terabyte scale data per day.




Role & responsibilities:

Data engineering activities including data ingestion, data modelling, data processing data governance
Work with team to improve the data pipeline to process large scale data efficiently
Be a data steward to educate and promote the data importance and data-driven culture
Collaborate with the key stakeholders, product owners, external vendors to define solutions for business and technical requirements
Be responsible for system architecture design and data engineering activities including data ingestion, data modelling, data processing and data governance
Work as a technical expert and strategic thought leader to the data platform by providing architectural leadership
Lead, participate, guide and mentor other team members on architecture and design with hands on




Desired skills & experience:

SQL
Python
AWS AND/OR Google Cloud (GCP)
Spark
Airflow
EKS
Experience working with data infrastructure (understand how spark runs, how airflow works with AWS)
Architecture design and development of large-scale data platform and data application with simple solutions
Have deep understanding on data engineering principles and data modeling
Strong knowledge of SQL (MySQL, PostgreSQL) and preferably experience with NoSQL databases
Experience with engineering tools such as Airflow, EKS, EMR, Redshift, Kubernetes
Good Hadoop ecosystem knowledge (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Hive, Presto)
Experience on large-scale multi-tier cloud applications and environments
Hands-on experience of high availability systems and API design
Experience with CICD tools such as GitHub Actions
Familiar with Agile/Scrum software development methodologies




$70 - $80 per hour for an INC consultant




If you're interested, please apply with resume

If you are a strong fit, I will be in contact quickly to discuss additional details and next steps

Best regards,

Title: Senior Analyst, UFC
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

We evolve our games and how players interact with them by using the power of data to continuously uncover insights to deliver an even better player experience. We strive to be the best-in-class AI team in the gaming industry by maximizing the fun for EA players through easier deployment of AI-driven solutions for game makers. Our insights are ubiquitous through autonomous analytics.

You will be a member of our Sports Analytics team and empower the UFC game team with data-driven insights, tools, and recommendations to make more data informed decisions, driving value for our business and players. This is a hybrid role located in Vancouver, B.C. and will report to the Director of Analytics of NHL and UFC.

Responsibilities


You will collaborate with your team to understand requirements and scope deliverables
You will guide the game team in being hypothesis focused, and data driven
You will deliver end to end analytics projects and present insights
You will develop a suite of dashboards to promote self-service data access
You will contribute to the aggregate layer of data to support efficient analysis
You will design game telemetry that meets analysis requirements


Qualifications


A degree in a quantitative discipline (Analytics, Data Science, Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics)
3+ years of experience in an analytics role performing quantitative analysis
1+ years of experience independently managing projects and building analysis plans
Expertise in SQL and ability to extract data from large data sources
Experience in statistical modeling with Python or R (e.g. regression, clustering)
Data visualization experience (e.g. Tableau, Power BI)


Compensation And Benefits

The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs).

PAY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria) * $89,300 - $123,000 CAD


In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

About Electronic Arts

Weâ€™re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.
